title: howto:wiki
body:
The Danbooru Wiki exists to provide information about topics relevant to the site. Primarily, wiki entries are used to explain the usage of the various tags given to posts. In addition, the wiki allows us to construct useful informational resources such as tag lists, tag groups, and "How To" pages such as the one you are currently viewing. 

This page will give you an idea of how to properly construct or edit an entry in the Danbooru Wiki, as well as some warnings regarding what conduct is unacceptable. As with all things, if you have further questions about the material presented here, you may ask a staff member or contributor for help. Most of us are glad to help you. 

If you accidentally create a non-relevant wiki page, you may delete it by clicking "Edit" and then clicking "Delete".

h4. Formatting

All wiki pages are formatted using "DText":/static/dtext_help.

h4. Style

Use "h4." for headers and "h5." for subheaders. Character names should be written in the same order as their corresponding tag.

h4. Images
Images can be added to wiki pages. For more information on images, see topic #26714.

To add a group of thumbnail images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1
* !post #2
* !post #3
[/code]
To add captions beneath the images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1: This is a caption.
* !post #2: Here's another caption.
* !post #3: Captions can contain links, like this: [[Touhou]].
[/code]
To add a single large image to a wiki (do this only for things like screenshots in help wikis, not tag wikis), write this:
[code]
!post #1
[/code]
To add an arbitrary image that isn't from a post, first upload it, then find it on the Media Assets page, then write this:
[code]
* !asset #19734342: [[Ford Mustang II]] (1973-1978)
[/code]

h4. Guidelines

h5. What NOT to do:

* [b]No spoilers.[/b] The wiki is not the place to give away plot information. If spoilers are [i]absolutely necessary[/i] in order to describe the basis of a [[meme]] or other tag, it [b]MUST[/b] be marked properly [code][spoiler][/code] like this [code][/spoiler][/code] to make it [spoilers]like this[/spoilers].
* [b]Do not make entries for nonexistent tags[/b], except to mark a tag as [[list of disambiguation pages|ambiguous]] or [[tag group:subjective|subjective]]. Do not make entries for characters or copyrights that don't have any posts. Do not make vanity entries for yourself or for other users. There are some exceptions for rules articles such as this one, or explanatory categories such as [[tag_groups]].
* [b]Do not be subjective or biased.[/b] Wikis should be purely objective. Your personal feelings on the issue do not belong. Do not use words like "stupid", "sexy", "annoying", or "awesome".
* [b]Do not create wiki entries without a proper understanding of the tag and its correct usage.[/b] A misleading wiki giving incorrect information to users does not help the site in any way.

h5. What to do:

* [b]Be concise.[/b] Provide only the basic information that someone unfamiliar with the subject needs to know. As a rule of thumb, avoid going beyond one to two short paragraphs. If possible, especially regarding characters and copyrights, provide a link to an outside website with further information for the benefit of those interested.
* [b]Be relevant.[/b] Only include information that is relevant to Danbooru. The main purpose of a wiki entry is to explain how a tag is used, not to list everything you know about the topic.
* [b]Use images that are as safe-for-work as possible.[/b] Blacklists currently don't apply to embedded images, so they should be safe for everybody. For NSFW wikis, at least choose images that are tasteful. 
* [b]Link to other wiki entries.[/b] When you mention another tag, don't forget to link to that tag's wiki entry.
* [b]List other relevant links.[/b] Put links to any other relevant tags or outside websites in a "[b]See also[/b]" section at the bottom of the entry.

h5. Character wiki guidelines:

* [b]List the copyright.[/b] Don't forget to mention which copyright the character is from.
* [b]Describe the character's appearance.[/b] Be descriptive enough that someone unfamiliar with the character will be able to recognize and tag that character.
* [b]List the character's name in kanji/kana.[/b] This is helpful for translators.
* [b]Use correct naming conventions.[/b] Characters are tagged in the way they are written in their native languages, thus [[kinomoto_sakura|Kinomoto Sakura]], not Sakura Kinomoto. This "original order" policy carries over from tagging into wiki writing as well as translation notes.
* [b]List other relevant tags.[/b] Be sure to list any other tags that relate to the character. These may include alternate versions of the character, [[genderswap|genderswaps]], [[parody|parodies]], and so on.

h5. Copyright wiki guidelines:

* [b]Provide a brief synopsis.[/b] A short synopsis to provide some context is helpful, but [b]do not[/b] describe the plot in detail and [b]do not[/b] provide spoilers.
* [b]List related characters.[/b] List any characters that are involved in the copyright. Do not list characters that don't have any posts. 
* [b]List related copyrights.[/b] List any related sequels, prequels, or spin-offs.
* [b]Refer to series using the name Danbooru uses.[/b] For example, use [[hayate_no_gotoku!|Hayate no Gotoku!]] in a wiki, not Hayate the Combat Butler. It may be appropriate to mention alternate or translated titles, but use our tag as the primary. Don't italicize the name.

h5. Artist wiki guidelines:

* [b]Don't create unnecessary pages.[/b] For artist tags, there is the "artist library":/artist. See [[howto:artist|how to use]].
* [b]Create pages without duplicating information.[/b] Sometimes it is required to specify additional information, then a wiki-page of the same name is created for the tag. Don't write a list of links and alternative names or nicknames. Use the artist library. 

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Wiki":/wiki_pages/help%3Atoc#dtext-wiki
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: sheeeh!
body:
A peculiar and infamous pose done by [[Iyami]] in the manga [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i]. It is accomplished by stretching out the forearm and bending a leg upwards while shouting the titular phrase (a shoe falling off is optional).

* !post #2184244

title: special_feeling_(meme)
body:
恋人といる時の雪って [b]特別な気分[/b]に浸れて僕は好きです
[i]"When it snows when you're with your lover, you can immerse yourself in a [b]special feeling[/b]... I like it."[/i]

Parodies of an emergency news program on the heavy snowfall in the Kantou and Touhoku regions in winter of 2013.

When a passing couple was interviewed and asked about the adverse weather conditions, the boyfriend started rambling about his girlfriend instead, causing her to hide her face in embarrassment. The boyfriend became the target of haters online and spawned many memes.

On February 8, 2014 (when another heavy snowfall came), "a person tweeted":http://twitter.com/rotomx/status/431983568676335618/photo/1 that screenshot and it became a visual meme.

h4.External links

* "Know Your Meme":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/special-feeling-%E7%89%B9%E5%88%A5%E3%81%AA%E6%B0%97%E5%88%86 
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5199043

h4.See also

* [[Super-cozy (meme)]]
other_names: 恋人といる時の雪って
恋人といる時の雪って特別な気分に浸れて僕は好きです

title: zui_zui_dance
body:
zui₍₍(ง˘ω˘)ว⁾⁾zui

A dance [[meme]] by [[zuikaku (kancolle)|Zuikaku]] & [[zuihou (kancolle)|Zuihou]] ([[Kantai Collection]]), where they perform a characteristic dance with an [[uwu]] face. Its origin is uncertain. Can also be applied to Zuikaku's [[Zuikaku (Azur Lane)|Azur Lane counterpart]], and said game actually had the dance as a usable in-game chat emote.

The oldest tweet that can be confirmed on Twitter, a "possible origin":[https://twitter.com/SK_KTKM/status/415114302601719808]

h4.See also

* [[dancing]]

title: genba_neko_(character)
body:
("Site Worker Cat")

An occupational [i]un[/i]safety-themed [[futaba channel]] [[meme]] character, whose face is based on [[Kumamine]]'s [[Denwa Neko (kumamine)|]].

Later [[Kumamine]] himself made a remake of the character, and named it 仕事猫 ([[Shigoto Neko]]). Kumamine's remake of the character can be distinguished from the Futaba version by way of their helmets, with Shigoto Neko having white hard hats with a black paw print symbol on it, while Genba Neko have yellow hard hats with green crosses for symbols.

h4. See also

* [[Genba Neko (meme)]] - for the pointing pose itself

h4. External links

* "The origin of the character's body (sozaing.com)":[http://sozaing.com/material/%E4%BA%BA%E5%9E%8B%E3%82%AA%E3%83%96%E3%82%B8%E3%82%A7%E3%82%AF%E3%83%88%e3%80%80%E6%80%92%E3%82%8B.html]

title: yaranaika
body:
Yaranaika (やらないか) or "Shall we do it?" is a popular catchphrase that stems from the opening dialogue in [[Kuso Miso Technique]], a [[Bara]] manga drawn by Yamakawa Junichi. The manga title's literal translation reads "Shit Soup Technique" in English.

In this scene, [[Michishita Masaki|Masaki Michishita]], an average college student, is walking through the park to use the public toilet when he crosses eyes with [[Abe Takakazu|Takakazu Abe]], an older mechanic sitting on a bench. Upon seeing him, Masaki says to himself [i]"Uho! Hot guy!"[/i] (うほ、いい男! - [i]Uho! iiotoko![/i]) while Abe promptly unzips his jumpsuit, reveals his "[[penis|unit]]" out in the open and asks, [i]"Shall We Do It?"[/i] (やらないか? - [i]Yaranaika?[/i]), and the rest is [[sex|history]].

h6. Usage

This tag should be used only on posts which reference:

* The scene in which Abe exposes himself
* The iconic reaction faces featured in the manga
* The phrase itself.

For references specific to characters and other scenes in the manga, please use the [[kuso miso technique]], [[Abe Takakazu]] or [[Michishita Masaki]] tags instead.

h4. See also

* [[Kuso Miso Technique]]

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme Page":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/yaranaika-%E3%82%84%E3%82%89%E3%81%AA%E3%81%84%E3%81%8B

title: mujun-gatamari_(meme)
body:
(むじゅんがたまり, lit. "clump of contradictions" or "ball of radical contradictions") also known as 間違いAA ("wrong ASCII art")

A specific style of [[ASCII art]] that originated on [[2channel]]. It can also be considered a style of [[meme]].

In the most common form, many rows of fixed-width ASCII characters are arranged to depict a [[logo]], above which appears a picture of a character or object, usually with a speech bubble beside it. Artists often make use of [[emphasis lines]] to give context to their subject. The defining feature of this [[meme]] is that no two components of the image can match. Quotes, onomatopoeia, artist [[commentary|commentaries]], tags, [[furigana]], and so on: no matter how many elements go into the image, each one is from a different source. Aside from the text, the picture itself often combines several characters into a kind of [[chimera]]. For example, the earliest known example of this [[ASCII art]] depicts a creature with [[Juushimatsu Juushoku]]'s head and the body of a dog, with a speech bubble saying "meow!!" and the caption "chick".

[[2channel]] users often deploy these pictures to defuse tensions in heated discussion threads full of arguments and flaming. Posting a Mujun-Gatamari usually carries an implicit meaning of "C'mon, you guys, chill out." In these cases, posters often introduce their image with a catchphrase meaning "殺伐としたスレに~が!! (Into the bloody fray of this thread, *** has arrived!!)" This usage originated with another [[ASCII art]] character, [[youkan_(food)|Youkan]] Man. Images of cheerful Youkan Man, who keeps on smiling no matter how many times he is cut in half, were once a popular option for calming down flame wars. Now, however, posters eschew this [[ascii art]] as something that just makes everyone angrier.

h4.See also

* [[out of character]] - some of [[out of character]] images on pixiv & NicoSeiga are incorrectly tagged as [[mujun-gatamari (meme)|]].

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia article":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4971717

title: kimoi_girls_(meme)
body:
Kimoi Girls (キモーイガールズ) is a [[futaba channel]] [[meme]] based on a panel (post #326017) from the short comic "PAY BACK" by [[Nitta Jun]], in which two nameless schoolgirls mock a virgin boy ([[Nakano Ryuuichi]]). This [[eromanga]] is a part of his 2002 book, [[Datsu! Doutei]].

This meme was popularized by the [[IOSYS]] [[flash]], "'Kanbu de tomatte sugu tokeru ～ Kyouki no Udongein'":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Lyrics:_%E6%82%A3%E9%83%A8%E3%81%A7%E6%AD%A2%E3%81%BE%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A6%E3%81%99%E3%81%90%E6%BA%B6%E3%81%91%E3%82%8B%E3%80%80%E3%80%9C_%E7%8B%82%E6%B0%97%E3%81%AE%E5%84%AA%E6%9B%87%E8%8F%AF%E9%99%A2 (post #91177).

Not to be confused with [[laughing girls (meme)|]], which is a similar but unrelated meme about two girls laughing.

[quote]
"えーマジ童貞!?" (What, really, you're a virgin!?)
"キモーイ" (How pathetic!)
"童貞が許されるのは小学生までだよねー" (Being a virgin is totally unacceptable past grade school.)
"キャハハハハハハ" (Hahaha!)
[/quote]

h4. See also

* [[Datsu! Doutei]]
* [[laughing girls (meme)|]]
* [[mesugaki]]

h4. External links

* Know Your Meme: "Kimoi Girls":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/kimoi-girls]
* [[2channel]] [[Ascii Art]] Illustrations (JP): "'Kimooi Girls'":http://riceballman.fc2web.com/AA-Illust/Data/KimoiGirls.html

title: too_low_salary_(meme)
body:
[b]年収低すぎ[/b] ([i]Nenshuu Hiku-Sugi[/i], Too low salary)

"うわっ…私の年収、低すぎ…?" ("[i]Uwa! ...Watashi no Nenshuu Hiku-Sugi...?[/i]", "What...? My annual salary is too low...?") is the phrase used by Career Design Center Co., Ltd. as part of their web advertising campaign to promote their site "'@type',":http://type.jp/help/category_2.html a career change information site.
This [[ad]] shows the photo of a surprised looking woman, overreacting as if it were the end of the world, together with the following text.
[quote]Recommendation: @type
"What...? My annual salary is too low...?"
A "market value diagnostic test" that you can take in 5 minutes for free. It will determine your basic business skills and the most suitable salary for you.
Over 400,000 people have taken this test!
An extremely popular test as you can also get your results straight away.
CHECK!
>>What is the most suitable salary for you?
[/quote]
This ad has been shown so frequently that it has sparked a lot of criticism on the web with comments such as "I feel really annoyed every time I see this advert", "I feel like I want to punch that woman" and "Is this really an advertisement? It looks like it might actually have the opposite effect!"
The majority of parody images about this advert have been uploaded onto the web and ultimately, even "a satirical song":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H-jLy2RXfEs has been written for it.
Ironically, those web pages containing these criticisms have actually ended up displaying the ad in question for '@type' practically every time, all thanks to the Adwords server.

title: m87_black_hole
body:
A [[black hole]] in the Messier 87 [[galaxy]] (hence the name). Famous for being the first black hole to be photographed, taken by the Event Horizon Telescope in 2017 and published on April 10th, 2019.

The image quickly became the subject of many [[meme|memes]], with artists creating [[personification|personifications]] of the black hole in a manner similar to [[Earth-chan]], or noting the resemblance of the image to anime eyes.

The black hole has since been named Powehi, a Hawaiian name meaning "the adorned fathomless dark creation" or "embellished dark source of unending creation."

* !asset #24661460

h4. See also

* [[Blackhole-chan]]
* [[Earth-chan]]
* [[Moon-chan]]

h4. External links

* "BBC: First ever black hole image released":https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-47873592
* "The Guardian: Powehi: black hole gets a name":https://www.theguardian.com/science/2019/apr/12/powehi-black-hole-gets-a-name-meaning-the-adorned-fathomless-dark-creation
* "Know Your Meme: First Image of Black Hole":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/first-image-of-black-hole
* "Wikipedia: Messier 87":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messier_87#Supermassive_black_hole

title: sunrise_stance
body:
An often-parodied [[sword]] pose associated with the animation studio [[Sunrise (company)|]]. Believed to have been started by a scene from [[Juusenki L-Gaim]] drawn by animator [[Oobari Masami]] (though the original scene features an energy cannon instead). Also sometimes referred to as the "Brave Perspective" for it's common usage throughout the [[Yuusha Series]].

The pose consists of a character [[holding sword|holding a sword]] (or other weapon) around their waist in a [[fighting stance]] with the tip of the weapon angled very close to the camera. The camera angle and the extreme [[foreshortening]] make the weapon appear much larger than normal.

h4. Examples

* !post #107211: Original scene from [[Juusenki L-Gaim]]
* !asset #21761964: The pose as seen in [[Yuusha Exkaiser]]
* !post #5369982: A typical "Sunrise stance" with [[mecha]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Brave Perspective":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/brave-perspective]

title: four_tips_to_improve_your_girl_power_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that was started from a love advice column on a Japanese website aimed at women in August of 2011. The column advised women to act ditzy and cute by doing things like pretending not to be able to eat [[omurice]] because of feeling bad about the chick dying when the eggs are broken.

"Four techniques for improving girls with girl power from such things as 'Attracting guys by being a woman who won't even eat an omelet.'":http://youpouch.com/2011/04/26/162331/ - August 26, 2011

[expand=Translated article]Hello, I am Lady Ebios a specialist in love management. I am an ugly person without an academic history or much common sense, but when it comes to love I am a professional. This time I think I should teach everyone about the four ways to improve women by using girl power.

1. Taking your two to three generations old [[cellphone]] to drinking parties

Lets make use of the two to three generations old cellphone. So at a drinking party talk to a man you like, and try to bring out your cellphone on purpose. Then say "Aww, I really hate using this cellphone!", it will make the man say "What's wrong." If he says this its been a big success. Say something like "I don't know much about cellphones~! I've been using this one for so long~! Its so hard to use! [b]Punpukuriin![/b] (Anger)." Since men usually want to have new cellphones, even if its old they are at least using last generations cellphones.

With that the man will definitely say "Why don't you buy a new one?" (Guys who don't say this and can't read the situation should in that moment be ignored and then move on). Then you will respond with "Well well~! Isn't the new iPhone5 popular-!? How is it? I want a new one but have no idea!! I'm so pitiful ★." Then the man will start to say "The iPhone4 right? They haven't made the 5 yet. You really don't know much do you. What kind do you want?" Then the next day off both of you will go on a date to choose cellphones. If your girl power is strong, then the guy might possibly buy the cellphone for you!?

2. Being able to use [[> <]] on Twitter

Things like "Ah-!" or "I'm sad" can be expressed with "[[> <]]" in comments, and then the Twitter's male users will think "This girl is kind of cute" or "I kind of want to help her." Images on the internet are more applicable to other users rather than in the world like having many uses for "[[> <]]" which will mistakenly make men think you are a pitiful woman. If you become this kind of character almost always ignore that you will be hated by the same sex.

3. For the time being always say to guys "Really-! What is that!? Tell me tell me. ♪"

Guys always talk about nothing but bragging and their hobbies when talking to girls at things like drinking parties. Thus, for girls its always a boring story. However, if you respond with the usual responses like "Wow, really~?" or "I don't really get it, but that's amazing," then the guy will notice that "This girl is no good." If you are revealed as a girl with not merit its over. It is then instead to say unintentionally with a lot of spirit, "Really-! What is that!? Tell me Tell me ♪." For instance, even its not a story about interests, then get through the situation with high spirits and positivity. Men have a weakness for women that will assertively listen to them talk.

After listening to different stories, then comment with something like "something, something, something right! Oh, I just remembered! Memo Memo!" and it will be perfect. Continuing on, point at your head and spin your finger around saying "[b]Kyun kyun kyun! Kyun kyun kyun![/b]" "What's wrong?" the guy might say. Then if you say "I am just recording it to my hard disk" your girl power will go up! With this the guy will again think "Wow this girl is interesting and cute!?" I don't have any academic history or much knowledge and I am ugly, but with if I use this kind of technique then even my non knowledgeable self that is a stupid woman can be popular. All because men want to feel like they are superior.

4. Attracting guys by being a woman who won't even eat [[omurice]] in a restaurant

If you go into a restaurant with a man, find the first thing you can with [[omurice]] or eggs in it and say "A-w! I can't even eat this~ (Sadness)." Then 100 percent he will ask "Why not? Do you not like it?" and you will respond with "I don't not like it, I just can't eat it [[> <]]." Again 100 percent he will ask "Since you don't not like it why can't you eat it?" and you will look down for 3~5 seconds and in between then say idly "...well,...well, if you break an egg then won't the chick die! Its so sad! It isn't even born yet~(Sadness). It won't even be able to chirp...." and shake a little while saying this.

In that moment, your girl power will go up. The man will definitely be charmed by you and from the bottom of his heart vow that "You are such a nice angelic like person! I will definitely get her! She is going to be my woman!" In the man's mind once you start dating, then forget about that sort of thing and only if you like it then it's okay to eat omelets. If he says "Didn't you say that you couldn't eat it?" then its okay to say something like "It's okay to eat it now" or "I've gotten used to it," or "I've never said that."

(Article = Love management by Lady Ebios)
[/expand]

This article has a sequel. See post #922277

h4. See also

* [[omurice]]
* [[meme]]

title: ips_cells_(meme)
body:
In [[Saki (manga)|]] volume 5, out of nowhere [[haramura_nodoka|Nodoka]] blurted out: "That reminds me. Apparently it will be possible for people of the same sex to have children through iPS cells."

"iPS cells":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Induced_pluripotent_stem_cell are stem cells derived from regular cells. They open up many new possibilities in medical treatments, and of course, human cloning.

Due to Nodoka's remark, "iPS cells" became a tag for pictures of a same-sex couple together with their child. And of course it also applies to any character repeating this line as a parody. 

The resulting babies are often referred to as "[[science babies]]" or "magic babies".

h4. See also

* [[female fertilization]]
* [[if they mated]]
* [[science babies]]

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: ips細胞":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/ips細胞

title: gachimuchi
body:
[b]Gachimuchi[/b] (or [b]Wrestling Series[/b]) is a [[meme]]tic universe which revolves around male porn actors (mostly from Can-Am Productions) flexing their muscles, wearing and doing [[BDSM]] stuff, and doing [i]gay pants wrestling[/i] (from where the tag gets its name, "Gachimuchi" meaning [i]buff man in underwear[/i] in Japan) in homoerotic films taken out of context.

The meme originated when [[Niconico]] members uploaded a video of [[Billy Herrington]] and [[Danny Lee]] doing [i]pants wrestling[/i] under the title "[b]本格的 ガチムチパンツレスリング[/b]" ([i]Professional Pant Wrestler Fighting Seriously[/i]) in 2007. This later spawned tons of parodies around [i]pants wrestling[/i] and related people that acted in non-pants wrestling porn with a pants wrestler as an actor in the aforementioned porno.

It is often paired with [[Manatsu no yo no Inmu]] (Inmu-chu) and [[Kuso Miso Technique]] ([[Yaranaika]]) as the "Holy Homo Trinity" (御三ゲイ), since all three were well-known homoerotic memes that were popular within Japanese communities in the 2000s.

While Gachi parodies did find their way outside of Japan, most prominently between 2007 and 2012, it wasn't until later from 2015 onwards that it spread even further under the name [b]gachiGASM[/b] (named after the BTTV emotes for [[Twitch.tv]] featuring Billy Herrington's iconic face) and spawned countless more sub-memes.

While Gachimuchi's popularity has decreased with the Japanese (being supplanted by Inmu on Niconico), Gachimuchi is currently extremely popular internationally. On the Chinese video site [[Bilibili]], the Chinese started making parodies of their popular TV series and movies, and also parodies of Japanese anime. Many Gachimuchi videos became some of the most viewed videos on Bilibili (one having had over 5 million views). This popularity would, however, lead to Bilibili attempting to squash the community on the site, leading to it dispersing across other Chinese communities. It also became popular in Russia, where a live-action parody and various music remix was made of it in spite of the country's anti-homosexual laws.

The tag used for Gachimuchi on Bilibili and in Chinese communities is [b]哲♂学 (Learning♂Philosophy)[/b].

title: you_died
body:
The [[game over]] message in the [[dark souls (series)|Souls]] series. The notorious difficulty of the series made the game over screen a [[meme]]. The message is often used as a punchline to imply a character's sudden or unexpected death.

"You Died" appeared earlier as the game over screen in the [[Resident Evil]] series, but in popular consciousness the phrase is usually associated with the [[Dark Souls (series)|Souls series]] and other [[FromSoftware]] games.

h4. See also

* [[bad end]]
* [[to be continued]]
* [[praise the sun]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: You Died":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/you-died]

title: loss_(meme)
body:
[b]Loss[/b], also known as CADbortion, Loss.jpg and | || || |_, is a series of [[parody|parodies]] based on a dramatic cartoon strip from the webcomic series [[Ctrl+Alt+Del]] in which the female lead suffers a miscarriage, which became a subject of widespread mockery among readers due to the drastic change of the comic tone that Ctrl+Alt+Del usually presented from comedy into drama.

Over time the comic has become the subject of such increasingly subtle and abstract parodies that the question "Is this Loss?" has become a [[meme]] in itself. This includes a running gag of including "simplified" reference in the form of  | || || |_ lines representing characters in each panel somewhere in the image, or even the image composition itself.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21218978: Origin
* !asset #24844761: Simplified version

h4. External links

* "Ctrl+Alt+Del: Loss":[https://cad-comic.com/comic/loss/]
* "Know Your Meme: Loss":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/loss]

title: nice_boat_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that originated from [[4chan]], which then cross-pollinated to [[2channel]] and the Japanese internet community.

It originated from the anime [[School Days]] when several broadcasters refused to air the final episode, considering it inappropriate due to a recent event of a girl murdering her father with an axe.

One station in particular, TV Kanagawa, aired a scenic nature program instead. One of the scenes in this program featured a boat on a lake, hence the phrase "nice boat". The phrase didn't really take off as a meme until the last episode aired, with it ending...  [spoiler]on a nice boat[/spoiler].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Nice Boat":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/nice-boat]

title: ran_ran_ru
body:
Ran Ran Ru (ランランルー, [i]Ran Ran Ruu[/i]) is a dance move performed by Donald McDonald, the Japanese interpretation of [[Ronald McDonald]], in a commercial for a mid-2000s [[McDonald's]] advertising campaign known as "Ronald Rumors" (ドナルドのうわさ, [i]Donald no uwasa[/i]), where he answered questions about himself.

The move is done in three steps:
* The hands are crossed and tapped on their opposite shoulders once. Donald says a single [i]ran[/i].
* The hands are clapped together once. Donald says a single [i]ran[/i].
* The hands are raised up straight and above the head. Donald finishes with a single extended [i]ruu![/i]

The move became a staple parody of fan artists, especially in Japan, with the Japanese video sharing site NicoNico being a particular hotspot for parody videos. One such video would have him do the dance in tune to [[Flandre Scarlet]]'s theme "U.N. Owen was her?", which would go particularly viral and have Donald associated with Flandre.

The advertising campaign would feature other commercials that would similarly go viral, such as him showing a different dance, him posing in front of a mirror, him falling backwards on a park bench after taking a phone call, and him playing baseball.

On Danbooru, this tag is primarily used for any character seen to be performing or demonstrating the Ran Ran Ru dance, but references to the other commercials in the Ronald Rumors campaign can also be tagged with it.

h4. See Also

* [[Ronald McDonald]]
* [[Ero aru yo (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Internet Archive: Donald Rumors":[https://archive.org/details/McDonaldsJapaneseCMRonaldMcDonald] (Ran Ran Ru at 3:04)

title: parody
body:
An imitation of another work, often for comic effect.

This often includes mimicking a scene, line of dialogue, art style, or something else from another series. It might also be a general spoof or reference to another series or character. 

Parodies and [[meme]]s are closely related. Usually a parody is a one-off joke, while a [[meme]] is a joke that has become popular and has been imitated by many people.

h4. Related tags

h6. Types

* [[card parody]]
** [[Cinderella girls card parody]]
* [[fine art parody]]
* [[logo parody]]
* [[poster parody]]
* [[source quote parody]]
* [[style parody]]
* [[title parody]]

h6. Specific parodies

* [[Honest axe]]

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[meme]]
* [[satire]]
* [[scene reference]]

title: women_want_me_fish_fear_me_(meme)
body:
A fishing [[hat]] (or other article of [[clothes writing|clothing]]) with copypasta phrase involving fish and women/sex/etc..

Originally "Women want me, fish fear me", there are numerous parodies, most notably:

[quote]
WOMEN FEAR ME
FISH FEAR ME
MEN TURN THEIR EYES
AWAY FROM ME
AS I WALK
NO BEAST DARE
MAKES A SOUND
IN MY PRESENCE
I AM ALONE ON
THIS BARREN EARTH
[/quote]

Another popular, shortened version reads:

[quote]
Man
I
Love
[[mature female|Fishing]]
[/quote]

h4. See also
* [[Man I Love Fishing (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/women-want-me-fish-fear-me-hat-parodies]

title: twitter_strip_game
body:
A [[Twitter]] art challenge where an artist draws a character and then removes an article of clothing each time a certain number of likes, retweets, or votes is achieved. Originally created by [[Scott Malin]] in June 2021, the format went viral as an art challenge on Twitter in 2022 and beyond.

Many different varieties of the format developed following the original challenge. This tag includes any variety of the format, includes parodies of the trend, giving the character more clothes, changing outfits, or doing other things besides stripping.

In February 2025 a new variant called the [[Twitter cutting game]] emerged, which involves cutting off parts of the character's clothing.

Not to be confused with a [[strip game]], which is where a group of characters play a game with each other and strip as a penalty.

h4. Examples

* !asset #10537201: Origin
* !post #6221885
* !post #8813748: [[Twitter cutting game]]

h4. See also

* [[like and retweet]]
* [[Twitter strip game parody]]
* [[Twitter cutting game]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Twitter Strip Game":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/twitter-strip-game

title: twitter_cutting_game
body:
A [[meme]]tic variant of the [[Twitter strip game]] where a character wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] decorated with [[cut-here line]]s, and parts of the shirt are removed as certain like or retweet goals are achieved. The trend is sometimes parodied by having other things cut or removed.

The trend went viral in February 2025 with a tweet by [[Je o mo]], but earlier precursors to the meme were posted in July 2024 by [[Ixopod]] and in November 2023 by [[Radon86 Nya]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8813748: [[Je o mo]]
* !post #7897730: [[Ixopod]]
* !post #7274675: [[Radon86 Nya]]

h4. External links

* "Twitter: 2025 tweet (by Je o mo)":https://x.com/Je_o_mo/status/1886618181495820329
* "Twitter: 2024 tweet (by Ixopod)":https://x.com/ixopod/status/1815466544643915991
* "Twitter: 2023 tweet (by Randon86 Nya)":https://x.com/radon1014/status/1720767191702974637

title: wing_collar
body:
A collar with folded-down corners, which form the "wings".

Note that "wing collar" on Danbooru has a different meaning. For tagging purposes, this tag refers to collars with large rectangular folds. For collars traditionally known as "wing collar", which are winged just near the tips, use [[wingtip collar]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #8600326
* !post #7878051: Left: wingtip collar, Right: wing collar

h4. See also

* [[collared shirt]]

title: fluttershy
body:
A yellow and pink pegasus and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. 

She lives by herself but has many animals in her care. As her name suggests, she is very timid, easily frightened, and she dreads social pressure and teasing. She has a pet rabbit named [[Angel Bunny]] who serves as the Alpha to her Beta personality, forcing her to do things that she wants or needs to do, but does not have the will for. Despite her usual personality, she can be very assertive if she is pushed far enough. 

In episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Kindness]].

She is close friends with the reformed villain [[Discord (my little pony)|]], and in the series finale [spoiler]the two are heavily implied to be a couple after the timeskip, though the writers have said they're leaving the two open to interpretation.[/spoiler]

* [b]English CV:[/b] Andrea Libman
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Katou Emiri]] (seasons 1-2), Ozaki Miku (seasons 3-6)

body:
Major [[My Little Pony]] character and reformed antagonist introduced in the [[My Little Pony: Equestria Girls]] series. Originally a [[sunset shimmer (unicorn)|unicorn]] training under [[princess celestia|Princess Celestia]] prior to [[Twilight Sparkle]], who abandoned her studies to cross through the mirror portal to the human world.

Unlike the others, she has no canon human world counterpart that we know of, though the idea was considered. The human form we see in Equestria Girls is simply a transformation of the pony world Sunset.

title: twilight_sparkle
body:
A purple [[unicorn]] and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] in [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]]. She was based on the the [[my little pony (g1)|G1]] pony [[Twilight (my little pony g1)|]].

She has been a bookworm from an early age, and has such great magical ability that [[Princess celestia|Princess Celestia]] chose her as an apprentice. Twilight is fanatical about organization, going as far as to make lists to help her keep track of her other lists. She tries to do things "by the book" and has a plan for nearly anything, but she has difficulty dealing with situations that didn't happen the way she thought they would.

In episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Magic]].

An of season 3, she has ascended to princess status and became an [[winged unicorn|alicorn]].

* [b]English CV:[/b] [[Tara Strong]]
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (seasons 1-2), Hanawa Minami (seasons 3-4), Tanaka Emi (seasons 5-6)

h4. See also

title: rarity_(my_little_pony)
body:
A white and purple [[unicorn]] and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] of [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]].

She lives with her [[sweetie belle|younger sister]] at her clothing boutique, where she is a self-employed fashion designer. Rarity is the most ladylike of the primary characters, striving to look and behave her best as much of the time as she can, but she occasionally has emotional outbursts. 

During episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Generosity]].

* [b]English CV:[/b] Kazumi Evans
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Sasaki Mikoi]] (seasons 1-2), Tabata Yukana (seasons 3-6)

title: rainbow_dash
body:
A blue [[pegasus]] with a multicolored mane, and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. 

Rainbow Dash lives by herself and works as a weather coordinator. During her obscenely large amounts of time off from this job, she is either being lazy or practicing her aerobatics in hopes of being accepted into the "Wonderbolts" stunt flight team. She enjoys pranks, as long as no harm is done by them. Rainbow Dash is very narcissistic and seems to have a very inflated ego. Despite this, she would do anything to help her friends. Her biggest flaw is her ego, which can lead to anxiety about maintaining her image as the coolest pony in town. 

In episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Loyalty]].

She has a friendly rivalry with fellow main character [[Applejack]] as they both are sporty, competitive, and tomboyish. In the series finale, [spoiler]the two are implied to be a couple after the timeskip, as they live together and are affectionate with each other, though the writers have stated that they're leaving their relationship open to interpretation.[/spoiler]

* [b]English CV:[/b] Ashleigh Ball
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Kitta Izumi]] (seasons 1-2), Izumi Shinobu (seasons 3-4), Ricky (seasons 5-6)

title: pinkie_pie
body:
A [[curly hair|curly-haired]] [[pink fur|pink]] [[pony (animal)|earth pony]] and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] of [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]]. 

She was born with [[straight hair]] and slightly more subdued colors, but these only return when she is in an exceptionally bad mood. She is very happy most of the time and is determined to make everyone else happy, usually by planning parties and making sweets at the bakery where she is employed. She often performs feats that defy normal logic, like coming onscreen from improbable angles, running or walking on thin air, and using her "Pinkie sense" to predict events in the near future. Her cartoonish and innocent nature contributes greatly to her main flaw: she is not very mature or responsible. 

During episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Laughter]].

Her full name is [[Pinkamena Diane Pie]], it's commonly used to describe her [[dark persona]] with straight hair.

* [b]English CV:[/b] Andrea Libman
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Mimori Suzuko]] (seasons 1-2), Misuzu Rie (seasons 3-6)

title: applejack
body:
An earth pony and one of the [[mane six (my little pony)|six primary characters]] in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. 

She is orange and yellow and usually wears a [[brown hat|brown]] [[cowboy hat]]. 

She works on a farm and orchard with her [[Big Macintosh|big brother]], [[Apple Bloom|little sister]], and [[Granny Smith (my little pony)|grandmother]]. It is not known who or where her parents are. Regardless of the language of the series' dubs, she always speaks in a rural accent. She is modest, but has a great sense of personal pride. This works against her sometimes, as she also feels deep shame in failure. 

During episodes involving the [[Elements of Harmony]], she represents the [[Element of Honesty]].

She has a friendly rivalry with fellow main character [[Rainbow Dash]] as they both are sporty, competitive, and tomboyish. In the series finale, [spoiler]the two are implied to be a couple after the timeskip, as they live together and are affectionate with each other, though the writers have stated that they're leaving their relationship open to interpretation.[/spoiler]

* [b]English CV:[/b] Ashleigh Ball
* [b]Japanese CV:[/b] [[Tokui Sora]] (seasons 1-2), Ogawa Natsumi (seasons 3-6)

title: ahsoka_tano
body:
A female character from [[Star Wars]]. She first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] movie.

[b]Ahsoka Tano[/b] is an [[alien]] humanoid (specifically, [[togruta]]) [[Jedi]] padawan.

She assigned as [[Anakin Skywalker]]'s Padawan learner during the Clone Wars. Though Anakin was initially dismissive towards her, she grew under his mentorship from a headstrong young student into a mature leader. Ahsoka participated in several vital battles over the course of the war, earning the respect of her clone troopers, but after being framed for bombing the Jedi Temple hangar and put on trial by the Republic, she left the [[Jedi| Jedi Order]].

title: star_wars:_the_clone_wars
body:
[i][b]Star Wars: The Clone Wars[/b][/i] is an American [[3D]] CGI animated television series created by George Lucas and produced by Lucasfilm Animation, Lucasfilm and CGCG Inc., released in 2008. 

This [[science fiction]] and fantasy series began with a [[Star_Wars:_The_Clone_Wars_(movie)|theatrical feature film]] that was released on August 15, 2008, and debuted on Cartoon Network two months later on October 3, 2008.

The show is set in the fictional [[Star Wars]] galaxy during the three years between the prequel films [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Episode II: Attack of the Clones]] and [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]. It follows the course of the titular conflict through the lens of various characters as they deal with the war's impact upon them.

The Clone Wars was a massive ratings success, becoming one of [[Cartoon Network|Cartoon Network's]] highest rated shows during its initial run. Throughout its run, the series received mostly positive reception from critics, receiving praise for its writing, action, characters, visuals, voice acting, music, scale and tone. 

The series has also garnered a massive fan following and has also been nominated for many USA entertainment industry awards, including the Daytime Emmy Awards and the Annie Awards. 

Not to be confused with the 2003 series, [[Star Wars: Clone Wars]], which was 2D animated and was declared as non-canon after Disney acquired the franchise.

h4. See also

* [[Anakin Skywalker]]
* [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]]
* [[Ahsoka Tano]]

h4. Sequels

* [[Star Wars: Rebels]]

* [[Star Wars: The Bad Batch]]

title: comb_over
body:
It's a hairstyle usually seen in [[bald]] men. The hair is grown long and combed over the top of the head to hide the bald area.

If you want to describe the hairstyle where the hair is parted to the side, please use [[parted hair]] or [[side part]].

title: side_part
body:
Hair that is parted distinctly to the left or right side of the head. If it's noticeably [b]parted from the roots[/b], it's [[parted hair]] as well.

For bangs that are loosely combed to the side, see [[swept bangs]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4502164
* !post #4668631
* !post #7945873: Side-parted hair with [[double-parted bangs]]
* !post #7842268

title: nezha
body:
Ambiguous character. Name written 哪吒.

A Taoist protection deity in [[chinese mythology|Chinese folk religion]]. His official Taoist name is [i]"Marshal of the Central Altar" (中壇元帥)[/i] and his title after he became a deity is [i]"Third Lotus Prince" (蓮花三太子)[/i].

After the death of his original body, his master [[Taiyi Zhenren]] used [[lotus root]]s and to revive him, he is thus often associated with lotus and has received many lotus-related nicknames.

He is often recognized as an [[otoko no ko]].

Nezha has frequently appeared in Chinese mythology and ancient Chinese literature such as "Fengshen Yanyi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Investiture_of_the_Gods and [[Journey to the West]].

h4. Copyrights featuring Nezha

These copyrights share [[Nezha (Mythology)]] as their character tag.

title: omaru_polka_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Omaru Polka]].

It consists of a [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[jester cap]], [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] [[hairclip]]s each one with a different card suit ornament at the end, a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[halter shirt]] with playing suit-themed [[bow button|bow]] [[buttons]] and a [[navel cutout]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]] with a [[red bowtie|red]] [[traditional bowtie]], a puffed [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-stripped]] [[blue skirt|blue]] and white [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[bow skirt|bow]] [[back bow|on the back]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] and [[uneven legwear|asymmetrical]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs|vertical striped]] [[cross-laced_legwear|cross-laced]] [[blue thighhighs|blue]] and [[pink thighhighs]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] [[red shoes|red]] [[pointy shoes]]. She also wears a [[single glove|single]] [[single elbow glove|elbow glove]] [[cross-laced_gloves|cross-laced]] [[multicolored gloves|multi-colored]] [[black gloves|black]] and [[red gloves|red]] elbow glove in one arm and an [[arm strap]] and a [[wrist cuffs|wrist cuff]] in the other.

title: bang_dream!_it's_mygo!!!!!
body:
BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!! is an anime in the [[BanG Dream!]] franchise. It aired from June 29, 2023 until September 14, 2023. A sequel titled BanG Dream! Ave Mujica started airing on January 2, 2025.

The series also includes two comics:
* [i]BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!! Ame ni Soyoide Hare o Kou[/i], Illustrated by [[Yuama]] with screenplay by "Haibuti Yotsuzi":https://twitter.com/haibuti_yotsuzi. Started serialization on December 27, 2024.
* [i]BanG Dream! Ave Mujica -manuscriptus-[/i] by [[Hiroyama Pinfu]]. Started serialization on January 10, 2025.

In addition to the series having similar themes, on 2024-07-05, a joint live concert between [[MyGO!!!!! (bang dream!)|]] and [[Girls Band Cry]]'s [[Togenashi Togeari]] on 2025-01-12 "was":[https://twitter.com/bang_dream_info/status/1809067177053728832] "announced":[https://twitter.com/girlsbandcry/status/1809067702126063829], prompting a lot of [[crossover]] fanart.

h4. Characters

h5. [[MyGO!!!!! (bang_dream!)|]]

* !asset #24008597: [[Yuutenji Nyamu]] / [[Amoris (bang dream!)|]][br]Drums

title: bang_dream!
body:
Stylized as BanG Dream!, a Japanese media franchise created and managed by [[Bushiroad]]. 

Originally started as a mobile rhythm game, the franchise later expanded with an anime series being broadcast since January 2017, multiple mini anime series, several manga series, and live concerts in which the voice actresses for six of the bands ([[Poppin'Party]], [[Roselia (bang dream!)|]], [[RAISE A SUILEN]], [[Morfonica]], [[MyGO!!!!! (bang dream!)|]], and [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]]) perform their instruments and respective roles.

In 2023, all of the main casts received a 3D live tracking model for their live and online performance, essentially making them pseudo-[[virtual youtuber]].

* [[BanG Dream! Mugendai Mewtype]]

title: shin_megami_tensei
body:
[b]Shin Megami Tensei[/b] (真・女神転生, lit. "True Goddess Reincarnation") is a series of RPGs developed and published by [[Atlus]], based on the [[Megami Tensei]] series of books, and games developed by Atlus (such as [[Megami Tensei II]]).

The games are known for having stories that focus heavily on religious themes, as well as the gameplay, where the player can recruit [[demon_(megami_tensei)|demons]] and deities from various mythologies and folklore.

h4. Mainline Games

* [[Shin Megami Tensei I]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei II]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: if...]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei NINE]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IMAGINE]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IV]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei IV Final]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: Liberation Dx2]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei V]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance]]

h4. Branch Series/Games
Numerous branch series and games have been made for this franchise, and are not considered part of the "mainline" Shin Megami Tensei games:
* [[Devil Summoner (series)|]] franchise
* [[Devil Survivor]] & [[Devil Survivor 2]]
* [[Digital Devil Saga]] duology
* Jack Bros
* [[Last Bible]]
* [[Majin Tensei]] series
* [[Persona]] franchise
* [[Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children]]
h4. See also
* [[List of Shin Megami Tensei demons]]
other_names: 真・女神転生シリーズ

title: yui_(princess_connect!)
body:
One of the main heroines of [[Princess Connect!]] and a member of the guild Twinkle Wish. She also appears in the remake, Princess Connect! Re:Dive.

She has [[medium hair|shoulder length]] [[pink hair]], [[large breasts]], and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] with [[puffy sleeves]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[gold hairband]].

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[Yui (real) (princess connect!)|Kusano Yui]] (草野優衣).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

h4. Appearance

title: princess_connect!
body:
Princess Connect! is a web browser game created by [[Cygames]] which closed in late 2015. In August 2016, [b]Princess Connect! Re:Dive[/b] was announced as a remake of the original game and advertised as an Anime RPG.

In February 2018, the game was officially released for Android and iOS. The remake is notable for using an anime-style format to tell its story complete with an "opening song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq8uuBB7SoM], "cutscenes":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=447], "ending credits":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XXC4TSTuxU], and even a next "episode preview":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=739]. Wit Studio is credited for the anime portions of the game. A global version was released on January 19, 2021, and later "ended":[https://www.crunchyroll.com/news/latest/2023/3/30/an-important-update-regarding-princess-connect-re-dive] on April 30, 2023.

The gameplay in the remake is heavily reliant on team composition to progress through the more difficult portions of the game and encourages raising multiple characters to complete certain challenges. Despite differing initial rarities, all characters can be raised to the maximum rarity which unlocks their full stories and maximum potential.

In the original story, the game was set in "Legend of Astrum", an MMO where the player would meet various girls and recruit them. Because of the MMO setting, each girl had a fantasy version and a real-life version. The story in the remake plays out as a sequel, starting the narrative with a "Bad End" to the original series in which the characters remain in the MMO, unaware of there ever being a separate real world.

h4. Main Characters

h6. Player

* !asset #20023209: [[Yuuki_(princess_connect!)|]]

h6. [[Gourmet Guild (princess connect!)|]]

The main guild in Re:Dive.

* !post #5904034: [[Kokkoro (princess_connect!)|]] 
* !asset #22889648: [[Sheffy (princess connect!)|]][br](from Act 2 onwards)

h6. [[Twinkle Wish (princess connect!)|]]

The main guild in the original game.

* !post #5903909: [[Rei (princess connect!)|]]

title: tag_group:people
body:
[See [[tag groups]].]

Tags denoting real people, rather than fictional characters.

A † mark denotes this person as deceased (not applied to historical figures, or to non-recent deaths who are not voice actors)

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Voice Actors":#dtext-voice-actors
* 2. "Cosplayers":#dtext-cosplayers
* 3. "Authors/Directors":#dtext-authors-directors
* 4. "Artists":#dtext-artists
* 5. "Actors":#dtext-actors
* 6. "Musicians":#dtext-musicians
* 7. "Television Figures":#dtext-television-figures
* 8. "Political Figures":#dtext-political-figures
* 9. "Businessmen":#dtext-businessmen
* 10. "Scientists and Engineers":#dtext-scientists-engineers
* 11. "Astronauts and Cosmonauts":#dtext-astronauts-cosmonauts
* 12. "Sportspersons":#dtext-sportspersons
* 13. "Military":#dtext-military
* 14. "Video games":#dtext-video-games
* 15. "Internet-related":#dtext-internet-related
* 16. "Other":#dtext-other
[/expand]

title: karyl_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from Princess Connect! Re:Dive (she did not appear in the original [[Princess Connect!]]). She also appears in [[Granblue Fantasy]] as a special event character, and in [[Shadowverse]] as both a card ("Karyl, Catty Sorceress") and a leader.

Karyl is Cygames' official localization of her name, but it may be spelled "Kyaru" or "Cal" by fans.

She is a [[cat girl]] with [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] stylized in [[low twintails]] and a [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streak]], as well as black [[cat ears]] with [[animal ear fluff]] and a [[cat tail]]. She usually wears a [[multicolored dress|multicolored]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[frilled sleeves]], black [[frilled thigh strap]], and [[black thighhighs]].

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[Karyl (real) (princess connect!)|Momochi Kiruya]] (百地希留耶).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Tachibana Rika]].

h4. Appearance

title: gundam_gquuuuuux
body:
A 2025 science fiction and [[mecha]] anime television series produced by [[Studio Khara]] and [[Sunrise (company)|]]. It is a part of the [[Gundam]] franchise.

The series takes place in Universal Century 0085 in an alternative timeline where [[Zeon]] successfully captured the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], which changed the outcome of "The One Year War."

title: p90
body:
A [[bullpup]] [b][[submachine gun]][/b], developed between 1986–1987 by Stéphane Ferrard at [[FN Herstal]]. It fires 5.7×28mm ammunition that resembles miniature rifle rounds, with more velocity and armour-piercing capability compared to conventional pistol rounds. The [b]P90[/b] introduced the PDW (Personal Defense Weapon) concept.

The [[weapon]] has a distinct futuristic appearance, ambidextrous controls, downwards [[casing ejection]], integrated [[optical sight|optics]] in the carry [[handle]] with backup iron sights on its top and feeds from an axially-mounted 50-round magazine.

h4. See also
* [[FN Five-seveN]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[p-chan (p90)|P-chan (P90)]]
* [[P90 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: FN P90":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_P90

title: byleth_(female)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Female version of [[byleth_(fire_emblem)|Byleth]], the protagonist character of [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. Has [[medium_hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[black coat]] like a cape, [[black shorts]] over a patterned set of [[pantyhose]], and an armored [[bustier]] that exposes her [[navel]].

title: crabrawler
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #0739 in the National Pokédex, a Fighting-type Pokémon. 
Crabrawler is a crustacean Pokémon resembling a crab. Most of its shell is purple with blue and yellow accents. It has two long, yellow antennae over its eyes.

It evolves into [[Crabominable]] when leveled up at Mount Lanakila (Generation VII) or when exposed to an [[Ice Stone]] (Generation IX+).

Japanese Name: [b]Makenkani[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Vikavolt]]
Next Pokémon: [[Crabominable]]

title: crabominable
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #740 in the National PokéDex, a Fighting/Ice dual type Pokémon. 
Crabominable is a crustacean Pokémon resembling both a horsehair crab and the mythical yeti. It is mostly white, with a blue face and details, and light yellow hair with two taller hairs sticking out on top.

It evolves from [[Crabrawler]] when leveled up at Mount Lanakila (Generation VII) or when exposed to an [[Ice Stone]] (Generation IX+).

Japanese name: [b]Kekenkani[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Crabrawler]]
Next Pokémon: [[Oricorio]]

title: topaz_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

A member of the IPC Strategic Investment Department and [[Ten Stonehearts]]. Voiced by [[Nanjou Yoshino]] (JP) and [[Sam Slade]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] buttoned [[white shirt]] worn under a thigh-length black [[unitard]] with [[detached sleeves]] and an IPC [[medal]] on her left breast side (and also accentuating [[thick thighs|her thighs]]), [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[black gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690037: Splash art
* !post #7861771: [[Topaz (Stoneheart's Oath Ring) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Stoneheart's Oath Ring]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Money is a means, not an end. Work should make you happy... That's the most fundamental principle."

Topaz, Senior Manager of the Strategic Investment Department in the Interastral Peace Corporation, and leader of the Special Debts Picket Team. Already a member of the "Ten Stonehearts" at a young age, Topaz's core stone is the "topaz of debt retrieval."

Her partner, the Warp Trotter "[[Numby (honkai: star rail)|Numby]]", is also capable of acutely perceiving where "riches" are located. It can even perform jobs involving security, debt collection, and actuarial sciences.

Presently they are traversing the cosmos together, chasing down various debts and liabilities that negatively influence the IPC's commercial ventures.
[/expand]
other_names: トパーズ(スターレイル)

title: jade_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

A member of the IPC Strategic Investment Department and the [[Ten Stonehearts]]. Voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a wide-brimmed [[black hat]], visible [[black bra]], [[two-tone dress]] set in [[blue dress|blue]] and [[white dress|white]], [[black jacket]], single [[thigh strap]] to her right leg, jade [[bracelet]] on her right wrist, [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand, [[black belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7726562: Splash art
* !post #8765002: Yet Hope is Priceless (signature Light Cone)
* !post #7852947: [[Jade (Stoneheart's Oath Ring) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Stoneheart's Oath Ring]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
"Wealth is the recipe to happiness. Giving it to those who desire happiness is making the best use of it. In this way, my job also brings people happiness. Anyone can receive this blessing... They only have to pay an equivalent price."

A senior manager in the IPC Strategic Investment Department and one of the Ten Stonehearts. Her Cornerstone is "Jade of Credit."
A cold and elegant moneylender, she is skilled at understanding the human heart, with a personal hobby called "Bonajade Exchange."
She's willing to wait patiently for high-value acquisitions and adept at extracting value from seemingly destitute clients.
[/expand]
other_names: ジェイド(スターレイル)

She serves as a potent mage and potential love interest of [[Byleth_(fire_emblem)|]], regardless of Byleth's gender. She is also (arguably) the game's best pick for the Dancer class.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[curvy]] figure with [[large breasts]], and typically shows off her [[cleavage]].

title: callie_(alterna)_(splatoon)
body:
Alternative outfit attributed to [[Callie (splatoon)|]] from the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series. It was introduced in [[Splatoon 3|Splatoon 3's]] singleplayer mode [i]Return of the Mammalians[/i] once the player has reached [spoiler][i]Alterna[/i], which serves as the main hub for the rest of the campaign[/spoiler].

h4.Description of the official design
The design is fairly similar to her original [[callie (squid sisters outfit) (splatoon)|Squid Sisters outfit]], but some notable differences. The skin of her [[sashimi]] headdress has become black (with yellow spots) and the [[leaf|shiso leaf]] that it rests on top of is yellow. Instead of having her longer tentacles tied up in a bow behind her head, Callie now has only has the left one tied up behind her, while the right one is styled to the front side of her face, similar to the default [[Inkling Girl]] hairstyle in [[Splatoon 1]]. She wears [[black gloves]], a [[sleeveless]], black, [[leather|leathery]] [[tube dress]] with three horizontal yellow cut-like stripes in the front, pearly-white [[pantyhose]] and black [[ankle boots]] with silver [[wedge heels]]. She also wears thick silver earrings, a large silver choker with a matching silver bandolier crossing her left shoulder down to the right side of her waist.

* !post #8827960

title: guile
body:
English: [i]Go home and be a family man![/i]
Japanese: [i]くにへ かえるんだな おまえにも かぞくがいるだろう...[/i]
[tn]([i]lit.[/i] "Go back to your home country. You also have a family of your own to take care of, I'm guessing...")[/tn]

--Guile, [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]

[b]Guile[/b] ([b]ガイル[/b]) is a video game character in [[capcom|Capcom's]] [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games. Although his role in the Street Fighter story is minimal, he is considered the third leading male character in the series, after [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] and [[ken masters|Ken]], largely due to his effectiveness as a character and his popularity.

When Guile was a Lieutenant in the United States Air Force, he befriended his superior officer, [[charlie nash|Charlie]] and asked him to teach him in his unique form of fighting, which Charlie agreed to do. Guile learned the style, but his hot temper caused him to be not as proficient in the moves as Charlie was (shown in how Charlie can shoot Sonic Booms with just one hand while Guile needs both.)

Guile has a wife, [[Julia (street fighter)|]] (ユリア), and daughter, [[Chris (street fighter)|]] (クリス, known as Amy internationally). Also, Julia and [[eliza masters|Eliza]] are actually sisters, making Ken and Guile brothers-in-law. However, this is not often discussed because, despite mutual respect as fighters, they do not think very highly of one another — Guile believes Ken to be a spoiled rich kid; Ken feels Guile is just another meathead soldier. In [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]], if Ken beats Guile, he'll refer to him as his "brother-in-law". 

There's a [[meme|running gag]] about his theme music from Street Fighter II "fitting in" or "going with" every scene or moment imaginable.
Also, a meme called [b]Waiting Guile (待ちガイル)[/b] refers to the strategy wherein the player crouches in the corner waiting for the opponent to approach, only to then hit them with either one of his charge moves.


The inspiration for his character comes from [[rudolph von stroheim|JoJo's Rudolph von Stroheim]].

h4. Known moves

* [[Sonic Boom (street fighter)|]]
** Sonic Hurricane

* [[flash kick|Somersault Kick (Flash Kick)]]
** Double Somersault (Double Flash)
** Somersault Explosion (Flash Explosion)
other_names: ガイル(ストリートファイター)

title: shin_shouryuuken
body:
The [b]Shin Shoryuuken[/b] (真・昇龍拳,"True Rising Dragon Fist") is a very powerful super combo/ultra combo move used by [[Ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] and [[Gouken]] in the [[Street Fighter]] series. It consists of three highly damaging hits, the third launching the opponent sky high. If not hit up-close, it will instead hit up to 16 times as an anti-air.

Started in [[street_fighter_III_(series)|Street Fighter III]] and later spread to the Capcom vs. games.

h4. See Also
* [[Shouryuuken]]

title: tatsumaki_senpuukyaku
body:
The [b]Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku[/b] (竜巻旋風脚, "Tornado Whirlwind Leg") special move that is primarily used by [[Ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] and [[Ken Masters|Ken]] in [[Street Fighter]], seeing the user spin through the air with a tornado-like kick.

Each variation of this move differs depending on the character and game; for instance, Ryu's version will hit once with a strong kick, while Ken's hit's up to three times―depending on the button pressed. Akuma's has multiple hits but also allows him to easily combo into a [[Shouryuuken]]. In earlier versions of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], this move functioned identically for both Ryu and Ken, hitting up to three times and having the universal property of passing over projectiles.

h4. Variations

* Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (竜巻旋風脚)

title: musket_planet_(idolmaster)
body:
Musket Planet is a [[COSMIC & FUNNY (idolmaster)|]] costume that first appeared in the original iDOLM@STER arcade game. With the exception of the mobile games, this costume has appeared in every game since its debut in some form via technicalities. Another costume in the EXTEND category, 876 PRO★Cosmic Ryo, was included in THE iDOLM@STER 2 and following Second Vision games. It is a direct copy of Ryo Akizuki's Musket Planet costume. 

h4. External links
* "project-imas wiki":https://project-imas.wiki/Musket_Planet
other_names: マスカットプラネット

title: new_york_state
body:
Use for posts centered around the state of New York. 

New York is a state in the northeastern United States of America. Its capital is Albany and its largest cities are [[New York City]], Islip, Yonkers, Buffalo, Rochester, and Huntington. 

It was one of the original thirteen colonies that went to form the United States.

h4. Notable Locations
* [[Niagara Falls]]
* [[Watkins Glen International]]

title: steely_dan
body: One of the many Stand users in [[Stardust Crusaders]]. His Stand is [[Lovers_(stand)|]]. Famous for being on the receiving end of one of [[Kujo Jotaro]]'s fiercest beatdowns. His namesake is the American fusion jazz band Steely Dan.

title: montreal_expos
body: The Montreal Expos (French: Les expos de Móntreal) were a Major League Baseball team based in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The Expos existed from 1969 to 2004. The team would relocate in 2005 to Washington D.C. to become the Washington Nationals.

title: toujou_fuyuki
body: [[Hara Taiyou]]'s gyaru wife.

title: mike_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] do massive damage to surrounding enemies through the power of terrible [[singing]].

!asset #24958637: Icon

In this form, Kirby wears a pair of [[red headphones|red]] [[headphones]] decorated with a [[yellow trim]] and a couple [[star print|stars]] on the sides. He also holds a [[microphone]].

title: zeus_(vtuber)
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], member of [[Mythos (VTuber)|]]. The group's personification of the Greek God [[Zeus (mythology)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. For her outfit, she wears a [[gold bra]] with a [[white dress|white]] [[ancient greek clothes|greek inspired]] [[chiton]] with a [[laurel crown]].

title: the_hundred_line_-last_defense_academy-
body:
A strategy RPG game developed by Too Kyo Games and published by Aniplex, from the creators of [[Danganronpa (series)|]] and [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]] (Zero Escape).

h4. Characters
* [[Sumino Takumi]]
* [[Yakushiji Takemaru]]

title: scottish_fold
body:
[b]Scottish Fold[/b] is a breed of [[cat]] originated from [[Scotland]], distinguishable by its forward-folded ears, generally rounded body, especially the head and face, very short neck, broadly-spaced eyes and medium-to-short legs. They can be either long- or short-haired, and they may have nearly any coat colour or combination of colours (including [[white cat|white]]).

Originally called [b]lop-eared[/b] or [b]lops[/b] after the lop-eared rabbit, Scottish Fold became the breed's name in 1966. Depending on registries, longhaired Scottish Folds are varyingly known as [b]Highland Fold[/b], [b]Scottish Fold Longhair[/b], [b]Longhair Fold[/b] and [b]Coupari[/b].

All Fold cats are affected by osteochondrodysplasia, a developmental abnormality that affects cartilage and bone development throughout the body. This condition causes the ear fold in the breed and studies point to all Fold cats being affected by it. Fold cats therefore have malformed bone structures and can develop severe painful degenerative joint diseases at an early age. Due to these health conditions, breeding Fold cats is prohibited in several countries and some major cat registries do not recognise the cat breed.

h4. See also
* [[Goldenglow (Arknights)]]
* [[Tag group:Cats]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Scottish Fold":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scottish_Fold

title: zuikaku_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Zuikaku[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[green hair]] in [[twintails]], [[yellow_eyes|yellow]]/[[green eyes]], and [[small breasts]]/[[flat chest]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] set comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder and propeller]] parts, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[yugake]], and a black [[muneate]] with her identifier "Zu" marked on it. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her [[flight deck]] on her left arm, her real-life hull to her back and used as a [[quiver]], and multiple [[anti-aircraft gun]] placements on her waist and thigh boots. 

In contrast with her sister ship [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|]], Zuikaku is depicted as a brash, hot-headed, reckless, and somewhat [[tomboy]]ish girl, in reference with her turbulent wartime career, in which she was credited for damaging and sinking several ships, but usually at a cost of large numbers of airmen.

She is frequently portrayed as a [[turkey]] and her in-game line "don't call me a turkey" is widely used as a joke on [[4chan]] and [[2channel]]. This stems from the IJN's notoriously poor performance in the battle of the Philippine Sea, where well-trained USN aviators referred to fighting inexperienced IJN pilots as a "turkey shoot". 

Her abyssal form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Crane Princess]].

title: kuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kuma[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[huge ahoge|huge]] zizag [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with Tama and Kiso, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white shorts]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, foremast, and funnels to her back, 14 cm gun mounts on the rig, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles.

As "Kuma" means "bear" and her catchphrase is "kuma", which she almost always appends to the end of her sentences, she is often depicted with [[bear]]-like qualities or dressed in a [[bear costume]]. She is most often paired with her younger sisters, especially [[Tama (Kancolle)|]]. Additionally, there's a joke about the "Kuma Fleet", which also includes [[Abukuma (kancolle)|]], [[Chikuma (kancolle)|]], [[Kumano (kancolle)|]], [[Mikuma (kancolle)|]] and occasionally [[Noshiro (kancolle)|]] (see post #1543570).

Kuma was last of her class to be given her [[Kuma Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] second remodels. She is sometimes grouped with [[Tenryuu (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shiratsuyu (Kancolle)|]] who also received their second remodels before being remodeled themselves.

title: ryuuhou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Ryuuhou[/i]. The remodeled form of [[Taigei (Kancolle)|]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[low twintails]], feathered [[hair flaps]] and an [[ahoge]], as well as [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a white [[hairband]], [[magatama necklace]], and [[pink coat|pink]] [[haori]] with [[floral print]] on the sleeves, and [[muneate]] and [[yugake]], while still wearing her base Taigei outfit ([[white shirt]], [[blue skirt]], [[black pantyhose]]). 

Her carrier [[rigging]] now consists of a [[bow (weapon)|yumi bow]], a [[quiver]] attached to her funnel back rig, and her [[flight deck]] on her left arm. Unlike the others, her flight deck is actually a flexible piece of armour instead of the usual rigid piece of wood.

Her in-game pre-kai ni shortcomings (slow speed, low plane count, low armor value) represent the real-life shortcomings of Ryuuhou when she was converted from seaplane tender to light carrier. Historically, she was the only warship damaged by the Doolittle Raid launched from [[Hornet (Kancolle)|]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: taigei_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine tender [i]Taigei[/i]. Upon remodel her name changes to [[Ryuuhou (Kancolle)|]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[low twintails]], feathered [[hair flaps]] and an [[ahoge]], as well as [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[white apron]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder-themed]] [[grey sandals]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and crane to her back, and her real-life bow as a [[single knee pad]] on her right.

Attempts to obtain her are unsurprisingly called "Whaling" on account of her name's meaning (lit. "Great Whale"). She was originally built as part of a project to build auxiliary support ships that could be converted to carriers quickly should the need arise. However, she suffered from faulty hull welding, unreliable diesel engine propulsion, and very questionable seakeeping (a flaw common to other treaty-skirting warships of her time). In late 1941, she finally received approval for carrier conversion and was renamed [[Ryuuhou (kancolle)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and an [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]] with [[empty eyes|no pupils]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back with a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Asagumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]]. 

There is an ongoing joke that she looks very similar to [[Error Musume]] in appearance.

Several of them, especially the more recent ones, are [[look-alike]]s of certain ship girls, as they represent their signature equipment. For example, the fairies of the Type 32 Surface Radar Kai "resemble Ise and Hyuuga":/posts/2044610. Alternatively, the Skilled Lookouts fairies "resemble Ayanami and Choukai":/posts/2200303.

title: suzunami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzunami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[green hair]] that [[gradient hair|gradiates]] to [[white hair|white]]. She wears her hair tied entirely into a [[half updo]] with a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], thus exposing her [[forehead]].

She wears the standard Yuugumo-class uniform, a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]].

In real life, [i]Suzunami[/i] led a rather short career like her sister [[Takanami (Kancolle)|]]: she was commissioned on July 27, 1943 only to be sunk by US carrier-based aircraft (including those from [[Saratoga (Kancolle)|]]) in an air raid on Rabaul on November 11, 1943.

title: fubuki_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]]'s second remodel.

Her white [[serafuku]] is retained but she opts for a [[black sailor collar]] with red stripes, while she also wears a [[black skirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with red stripes: the default Special Type Kai Ni uniform.

As for her [[rigging]], she replaces her original 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type A with a 10 cm twin DP gun mount and wears a type 94 anti-aircraft fire detector on her left wrist. She also gains a [[radar]] on her mast. Her use of this gear is hypothetical, however. She was sunk in the battle of Cape Esperance (October 1942) before she ever had a chance to be refit with AA weaponry. Unlike other hypothetical second remodels, she does not require a blueprint for the remodel.

She gained her second remodel with the January 9th 2015 update (timed with the premiere of the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]]) and thus became the first starter ship to have one.
