title: amagiri_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel/kai ni of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Amagiri (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon kai ni, she retains her original white [[serafuku]] and [[grey sailor collar]] but now wears an armor top over it, integrated to her [[rigging]]. She also retains her [[bike shorts]], [[grey skirt]] with [[side slit]] from her base form, but her [[rudder footwear]] now reaches up to the knee level. She also gains red [[fingerless gloves]]. In transport destroyer form, she also wears a [[single leg pantyhose]] to her right.

Her [[rigging]] varies between standard destroyer and transport destroyer. In the former, she keeps all three of her 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and has a [[searchlight]] on her armor straps. In the latter, she discards the searchlight and two of her torpedo tubes for a launch ramp and additional 25 mm AA guns. In both forms, she uses a 12.7 cm twin gun mount type B [[handgun]] and gains [[radar]] on her mast rig.

h4. Appearance

title: south_dakota_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]South Dakota[/i] (BB-57). Character design by [[Zeco]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[red hair|red]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[brown jacket]], [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]], [[black necktie]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[see-through legwear|see-through]] [[single leg pantyhose]], and [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[thighhighs]] (solid [[black thighhighs|black]] on her right, see-through on her left).

Her [[rigging]] consists of two split hull pieces containing her three 406 mm triple gun mounts and eight 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] mounts, with her real-life mainmast as a [[staff]]. 

She is oftentimes depicted with [[Kirishima (kancolle)|]], who helped cause great damage to South Dakota during the second naval battle of Guadalcanal and in turn was inflicted fatal damage from [[Washington (kancolle)|]]'s firepower. South Dakota and Washington are also depicted as not being in good terms, reflecting the great rivalry their crews had. There is an electrical switch on the left side of her gear, which can be observed more clearly on her damaged art. In her kai art, a yellow warning stripe is taped over the switch, referring to her infamous short circuit incident during the battle.

title: conte_di_cavour_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Conte di Cavour[/i]. Designed by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]], voiced by Iida Hikaru.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] light [[grey hair]] tied in a [[two side up]] hairstyle. She wears a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] white and grey [[frilled dress]] that has [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[armpit cutout]]s. She bears visibly oversized [[rigging]] mainly composed of [[cannon]]s, [[ship turret|turret]]s, and [[smokestack]]s, including her three triple- and two-twin 305-mm guns.

The short length of the historical battleship translates to a petite childlike appearance that is belied only by her [[large breasts]] and mature voice, to the point she is oftentimes mistaken for being an [[oppai loli]]. Because she is the oldest and shortest battleship in the game, her lines have her being [[height conscious]], having back pain due to her [[rigging]], and complaining about the other Italian shipgirls already in the base, particularly [[Pola (kancolle)|]] and several of the [[Maestrale (kancolle)|]]-class girls for their behavior and [[Roma (kancolle)|]] for calling her nosy and old. She does go along well with [[Gangut (Kancolle)|]] as long as she is not served vodka all the time.

The historical [i]Conte di Cavour[/i] was the nameship of the three [i]Conte di Cavour[/i]-class dreadnought battleships of the [[Regia Marina]]. She served in both world wars, although she saw no action in World War I. She was badly damaged by British torpedo bombers in November 1940 and deliberately run aground. Repairs were never completed by the time of the Italian armistice in 1943. She was captured by the Germans, but they made no efforts to complete her repairs. She was damaged in an Allied air raid in early 1945 and capsized a week later. She was eventually scrapped in 1946.

title: valiant_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Valiant[/i] (02). Character designed by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] [[low-tied long hair|tied low]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[blue corset]], [[blue cape]], [[mini crown]], [[red bow]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces held by a central segment to her back containing three 381 mm twin gun mounts, 152 mm single casemate guns, and a [[crane]], plus her real-life mainmast as a [[scepter]].

title: hayashimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hayashimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in a modified [[hime cut]] with [[hair over one eye|her bangs covering her right eye]], hair ribbons, and a generally flared but clean-cut appearance.

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a purple [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose|grey]] opaque [[pantyhose]] with [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She speaks like a stereotypical Japanese regretful or vengeful ghost (particularly [[Yamamura Sadako|Sadako]] from [[The Ring]], whom she resembles) including lines that make her sound obsessive and creepy. She is portrayed as perpetually mournful of her real ship's fate, and her inability to change that fate. Because of her lines, particularly her secretary line "Just like this, I'm always watching. Watching... Always... Forever", she is stereotyped as an obsessive stalker.

title: mizuho_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Mizuho[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (kadokawa)|]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] [[low-tied_long_hair|tied low]] with a rice stalk [[hair ornament]] and [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbons]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[green dress]] in a vaguely [[hakama skirt]] style with an oversized [[obi]], [[white jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[bridal gauntlets]], [[green socks]], and [[platform footwear]]. Medium damage reveals white lace [[panties]] with red [[ribbon]] trimming similar to a [[miko]]'s sleeves. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 12.7 cm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on a Shinto offertory pedestal with [[shide]], and a hull piece to her back with her real-life cranes, mast, and [[aircraft catapult]]s. 

Despite having a large number of seasonal CGs, most have little variance between them.

Historically, she was sunk early in the war on May 2, 1942 by USS [[Drum (kancolle)|]]. While her name literally means "Young ear of rice", it is an ancient name for Japan: [i]Mizuho no Kuni[/i], the "Country of Abundant Rice".

title: i-36_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-36, calling herself "Miimu." Character design by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] done into [[twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a blue [[school swimsuit]] with her name tag, worn under a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[grey sailor collar]], [[blue neckerchief]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces held to her body on straps, [[aircraft catapult]] on her right side, and her real-life 14 cm gun and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on [[thigh strap]]s. Her kai form replaces the catapult and 14 cm gun with additional torpedoes.

title: yuugumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yuugumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[green hair]] tied to a [[braid]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole_under_mouth|mole below her mouth]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She acts as a reliable older sister towards her sister ships as well as to the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]] whom she like to spoil often.

title: irako_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese supply ship [i]Irako[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]] secured with a red [[hair ribbon]], and light [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt]], [[black necktie]], [[blue skirt]], [[white apron|white]] [[kappougi]], [[white socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is a hull piece to her back containing her funnel, foremast, bridge, crane, and a 12 cm twin gun mount.

Like Mamiya, she is a non-combatant and is only available as an item card. She has the ability to sparkle several ships of a fleet.

title: libeccio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Libeccio[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]] and [[tan]]ned skin. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. 

The historical [i]Libeccio[/i] was assigned in 1941 to escort a convoy bound for Libya when the convoy was attacked. She escaped damage and attempted to pick up survivors of the destroyed convoy but was torpedoed on her stern by a Royal Navy submarine, later sinking under tow. This explains her moderate damage voice lines and repair lines where she doesn't like being hit in the same area.

She bears some resemblance to [[Strike Witches]]' [[Francesca Lucchini]].

title: akebono_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel (kai ni) of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Akebono (Kancolle)|]]. 

Upon kai ni, Akebono's outfit is still essentially the same as her first remodel's, only adding a pair of [[black gloves]] and a [[black choker]]: the most obvious difference if she's not depicted with her battle rig. 

Her [[rigging]] has been upgraded with AA guns (two 25 mm triple mounts, one on each side of her funnel rig), with her main gun being a 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type 89 attached to a rifle stock and augmented with 12.7 mm light machine guns. She also gains a pouch attached to her [[belt]] with some [[depth_charge|depth charges]] attached. Her rig attachment straps are also colored grey with a Type 13 [[radar]] on her left side.

title: akebono_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akebono[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], plus a [[hair flower]] and [[hair bell]]. Her default outfit is shared with the other Special Types, consisting of a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt and [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[pleated_skirt]]. She also typically wears [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[loafers]] outside of her combat gear. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel-mast set worn like a backpack, a handheld 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and carried over a shoulder strap. Her shoes are armored, and she wears dual torpedo turrets on her thighs, like many in the [i]Fubuki-class[/i]. She refers to the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] as a "[[Shitty Admiral_(phrase)|]]" and is seemingly always angry about something, stemming from her ill experiences during the war. In some fanworks, calling the admiral "shitty" is so ingrained in her, she even calls the admiral "shitty admiral" when she's in love, like other girls might say "darling". She's typically portrayed as a [[tsundere]] with almost no dere, at least not verbally, or a "bitter-tongued tsukkomi. Oftentimes, she's seen playing a big sister role to [[Ushio (kancolle)|]], who is often portrayed as the most childish and clumsy of the 7th Des Div. Along with the rest of the 7th DesDiv, Akebono has been one of the most frequent targets of limited-time special event artwork. h4. title: littorio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Littorio[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]] that is swept over her shoulder, [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with additional [[detached sleeves]], [[red necktie]], [[grey corset]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red stripes, grey-green [[rudder footwear]], and a [[white hat|white]] [[headdress]] with [[feathers]] patterned off her real-life bridge. Her [[rigging]] is a split-hull design with the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow stripes, all three of her 381 mm triple gun mounts, additional [[anti-aircraft gun]]s in her kai form, and fire control directors on her thighhighs.

In real life, she was renamed [[Italia (kancolle)|]] after [[Benito Mussolini]] fell from power, but her rename comes with her kai form in-game.

title: kinu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kinu[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]], [[orange eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her base outfit is shared with her sisters Yura and Abukuma: a buttoned [[white shirt]] with light [[green sailor collar]], [[green skirt|light green]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of four 14 cm single gun mounts (two on her wrists, two on her rig), held by a funnel piece to her back.

Personality-wise, she is an energetic girl, a prankster, especially towards the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], and a joker who just wants to make others laugh.  Although she is named after a river, her name literally means "angry oni", which explains her arms-up pose in her base art.

title: chougei_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine tender [i]Chougei[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twin braids]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister [[Jingei (Kancolle)|]]: a [[blue serafuku|blue]] [[serafuku]] with a [[white neckerchief]] and [[blue sailor collar]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] under a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[brown jacket|brown]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black thighhighs]], [[headgear]] which incorporates a white [[headband]], and a [[whale hair ornament]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel piece to her back with two hull pieces (containing 14 cm twin gun mounts and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s), [[drum (container)|oil barrel]], and a crate containing potatoes. 

Since she is the younger sister, she comes off as perkier than the more reserved [[Jingei (Kancolle)|]].

title: tone_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Tone[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twintails]] with two white [[hair ribbon]] accessories, and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[green dress]], [[black belt]], [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[single elbow glove|single]] [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her left arm with an [[aircraft catapult]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her left leg, and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of all four of her historical 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right side (three on her thigh, one on her right shoulder), [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her boots, and a seaplane cradle on her thighhigh.

She is notable for her old-fashioned militaristic speech patterns and somewhat aggressive personality. Her sister ship, [[Chikuma (Kancolle)|]], is a notable siscon.

title: ryuuhou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Ryuuhou_(kancolle)|]], released on April 22, 2020. Comes in standard CVL Kai Ni and an alternate Kai Ni (E) specializing in ASW/night ops. Unusually, she gets the Kai Ni E remodel [i]before[/i] Kai Ni and not after. 

Her kai ni outfit keeps the [[green skirt|green]]/[[pink skirt]] but the [[green sailor collar|green]]/[[pink sailor collar]] is integrated to a tabard-like garment. She keeps the [[red necktie]] and the [[muneate]] but the yugake is replaced by [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] on both hands, while the [[magatama]] becomes an [[earrings|earring]]. Her [[single knee pad]] is now a full-on greave and her pantyhose is open at three toes each foot. Her [[headband]] is changed to one akin to the Japan Post emblem: a hinomaru flanked by a single red stripe.

Kai Ni reverts her to her pink color scheme, but Kai Ni E portrays her in her real-life green [[camouflage]]. 

In both cases, her second remodels correct the historical deficiencies of the original Ryuuhou (as reflected in [[Ryuuhou Kai (Kancolle)|her kai form]]) by boasting double the plane capacity and slightly better armor values. However, she requires a prototype catapult for the first second remodel (Kai to Kai Ni E) as she never historically received further upgrades after mid-1944.

title: ooyodo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Ooyodo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], a [[hairband]], [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[green eyes|green eyes]] with [[glasses]], and [[small breasts]]. In the game, she has two roles: as the girl who appears in the quest menu, taking the role as "Ninmu Musume" or "Mission Girl"; and as a playable ship, whose upgraded version contains a command facility that can retreat damaged ships.

Both versions of her wear a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip_vent|hip vents]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[thigh boots]]. 

As an NPC, she carries notebooks and holds a [[quill]]. As a playable character, she uses a 15.5 cm triple gun mount as a [[handgun]], an [[aircraft catapult|catapult]] attached to her right arm, another triple gun holstered on her thigh and a large seaplane hangar attached to her back. Several [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts are attached to her and her hangar, and there are three masts with [[radar]]s on top of the rig.

title: maru-yu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese army submarine Maru-Yu. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]]. 

She is portrayed with [[parted_bangs|parted]] [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white one-piece swimsuit]] with a red encircled "yu" printed on it, [[diving mask]], and a [[flotation belt]]. Carries a transport container in her left hand and an [[FP-45 Liberator]] [[handgun]]. 

Historically, the Maru-Yu submarines were of a highly unusual design, and initial tests failed to get the prototype Maru-Yus to actually submerge, causing many Maru-Yu jokes to involve her only managing to get her head underwater while her legs still flail above water.  [[kiso (kancolle)|Kiso]] was nearby in the test runs, and Kiso's crew made jokes about the Maru-Yu's strange shape, causing some artists to treat Kiso as some sort of senpai to Maru-Yu because of it.

title: oyashio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Oyashio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]]. 

She has shoulder-length [[black hair]], held back with a [[hairclip]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her outfit is the Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a black [[vest]] over a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress_shirt|dress shirt]], [[white gloves]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Each class member has a different color for their [[neck ribbon]], hers is [[purple ribbon|purple]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with her Konishi-designed sisters: her real-life bridge to her back with a 12.7 cm twin gun mount and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached, a second 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], and [[thigh strap]]s containing a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s.

title: hatsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsukaze[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair|blue]] in a [[hime cut]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform ([[white shirt]], [[black vest]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]), with Hatsukaze's defined by her [[yellow ascot]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge to her back, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her left, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount to her right, another 12.7 as a [[handgun]], and two 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Skins

* !post #2082885: Default
* !post #2204020: [[Hatsukaze (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]
* !post #8279680: [[Hatsukaze (Kure) (Kancolle)|Kure collab]], left

h4. Personality and history
In real life, the destroyer Hatsukaze was sunk in an accidental collision with [[myoukou (kancolle)|Myoukou]]. Because of this (and the general fact that most destroyers have little that distinguishes them from the dozens of other destroyers), she frequently refers to "Myoukou-onee-san," either running to Myoukou any time there is trouble, or saying that enemies aren't nearly as scary as Myoukou-onee-san. Because the collision specifically sheared off her bow, she is also often depicted with a [[disembodied head]].

title: sazanami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Sazanami[/i], and one of the five starter ships. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] held with [[hair bobbles]]. On her lower right waist is a round [[badge]] with a strawberry-like pattern. When heavily damaged, she is revealed to be wearing [[strawberry print]] [[strawberry panties|panties]]. She has a tiny pink [[rabbit]] companion. The 7th Destroyer Division (Sazanami, [[Akebono (kancolle)|]], [[Ushio (kancolle)|]] and [[Oboro (kancolle)|]]) all wear a variant of the Fubuki-class standard [[serafuku]] as well as dark green versions of the Fubuki-class ship parts and rigging. She talks in random pop-culture references, memes and internet slang and refers to the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] as "master" as if she was a [[maid]] in a [[maid cafe]] (her new remodel CG emphasizes this point). h4. title: african_wild_dog
body:
The wild dog — also sometimes called the hunting dog or African painted dog — has a colorful, patchy coat; large bat-like ears; and a bushy tail with a white tip that may serve as a flag to keep the pack in contact while hunting. No two wild dogs are marked exactly the same, making it easy to identify individuals.

h4. See also

* [[African Wild Dog (Kemono Friends)]]

title: serval
body:
A slender African wildcat with long legs, large ears, and a black-spotted orange-brown coat.

For the [[Kemono Friends]] character, see [[Serval (Kemono Friends)]].

title: sueda_akihiro
body:
Key animator, animation director.

[b]Note[/b]
The family name might be read as [i]Sueta[/i] (a bit less common, but the possibility can't be ruled out).

title: pesenka_(ruki_vverh!)
body:
A song by the Russian Eurodance group Ruki Vverh! (Руки Вверх, lit. "Hands Up!") from 1998. Also known as Песенка (lit. "little song") or "Pesenka (La La La)".

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Pesenka":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pesenka]

title: kaiko_(vocaloid)
body:
A fanmade Vocaloid that is the [[genderswap|female version]] of [[Vocaloid]] [[Kaito (vocaloid)|]]. In Japan, it is very common to have female names end in -ko.

Her first outfit design is based on the [[Idolmaster]] outfit - [[Cute_&_Girly_(idolmaster)|Cute & Girly]]. While the most recent outfit (post #353560) is designed by [[Brian Narita (sorbe)|]], which is a feminine take on Kaito's original outfit.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: new_york_city
body:
The largest city of the [[New York State|state of New York]]. It is also the largest city in the [[United States]] and a major commercial and cultural center. 

Founded by the Dutch as New Amsterdam, it was renamed by the English in honor of the Duke of York. Originally consisting only of Manhattan Island, it was rechartered in 1898 to include the five present-day boroughs of Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, and Staten Island.

Site of the [[9/11]] terrorist attack.

New York is the central location for many of [[Marvel]]'s comic series and superheroes, being home to Avengers Tower in the [[Avengers (series)|]] comics and the Baxter Building; the [[fantastic four|Fantastic Four's]] headquarters, as well as being the home city and main setting for [[Spider-Man]] and [[Daredevil]]'s stories.

h4. Locations

* [[Central Park (new_york)|]]
* [[Chrysler Building]]
* [[Empire State Building]]
* [[Brooklyn Bridge]]

* [[Pier 17 (new york)|]]

** [[One World Trade Center]]

title: sf-a2_miki
body:
SF-A2 codename miki ("miki") is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Her appearance was illustrated by [[Kozaki Yuusuke]]. She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. Her body visibly displays her robotic joints. She wears a [[tube dress]] with a [[belt]], [[striped]] [[gloves]] and [[over-kneehighs]], and white [[boots]]. Her [[headset]] is blue with a [[star (symbol)|]].

title: sakine_meiko
body:
An officially recognized derivative of the [[VOCALOID]] [[Meiko (vocaloid)|]]. Her design is by [[daigoman]] and her voice arranger is Nanameue-P. She wears a [[crop top]], giving her an exposed [[midriff]], her [[skirt]] is puff, and she wears brown [[boots]].

Sakine Meiko's appearance is meant to reflect her VOCALOID2 Crypton compatriots and represent a [[aged down]] version of MEIKO herself. When treated as a separate character she is the younger sister of [[MEITO (Vocaloid)|]].

Although she is a variant of MEIKO, she is given a young singing voice that is higher in pitch compared to how MEIKO is usually heard.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "NicoNico video":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3995696

title: meiko_(vocaloid)
body:
MEIKO is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by the YAMAHA Corporation and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the first VOCALOID engine. She was later adopted by Crypton as an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and wears a red [[miniskirt]], [[crop top]], and [[boots]]. She is often seen with a [[microphone stand]], and is also frequently seen drinking from One Cup Ozeki, a [[sake]] widely available through vending machines.

She is voiced by singer Haigo Meiko. Her first appearance was illustrated by Wasshi, with her [[Meiko (Vocaloid3)|second appearance]] for VOCALOID3 illustrated by [[iXima]].

h4. Official art

* !post #1620945: [[Meiko (Vocaloid3)|VOCALOID3]]
* !post #7936792: [[Meiko (sp) (vocaloid)|SUPER PACK]]

h4. See also

* [[Meiko (Vocaloid3)]]
* [[Meiko (sp) (vocaloid)|]]
* [[Meito (vocaloid)|]]
* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: hatsune_mikuo
body:
A fanmade Vocaloid that is the [[genderswap|male version]] of [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]]. Not much is known about Mikuo except that he inherits some of Miku's fanon traits, especially those regarding leeks. His voice is a masculinized version of Miku's voice samples.

Mikuo is often written as Miku's bigger brother than a twin. He is often illustrated with a body build like [[Kaito (vocaloid)|]]'s, but illustration of Mikuo similar to [[Kagamine Len|Len]] (in shotacon sense) is not uncommon. He is said to be buddies with fellow derivatives [[Akaito]] and [[Meito (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]
* [[List of genderswap characters]]

title: meito_(vocaloid)
body:
A fanmade VOCALOID derivative that is the male version of [[VOCALOID]] [[meiko (vocaloid)|MEIKO]]. When treated as a separate character he is an older brother to his sister [[Sakine Meiko]]; taking on the family name 咲音 Sakine.

When Kaito is genderswapped to KaiKO, the -to was changed to -ko. So when MEIKO is genderswapped, her name changes to MeiTO.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: kaito_(sp)_(vocaloid)
body:
The design for [[VOCALOID]] [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]'s voicebank in the "PIAPRO CHARACTERS SUPER PACK" product announced on August 1st, 2024. As usual, this design was illustrated by [[iXima]].

The pack includes one new voicebank for each of the [[Piapro studio|Piapro]] characters, all of which are updated versions of their previous VOCALOID voicebanks. The designs for this version are their immediately previous VOCALOID designs altered with elements of their older/original designs.

This version of KAITO is based on his [[KAITO (Vocaloid3)|VOCALOID3]] design. His scarf has the same [[tie clip]]s that [[Hatsune Miku|Miku]] has. His shirt is black instead of blue and his pants are now grey instead of the blue/purple of his V3. His boots are shorter and he wears [[fingerless gloves]]. His belt has a [[piano print]] on it.

body:
The design for [[VOCALOID]] [[Kagamine Rin]]'s voicebank in the "PIAPRO CHARACTERS SUPER PACK" product announced on August 1st, 2024. As usual, this design was illustrated by [[iXima]].

The pack includes one new voicebank for each of the [[Piapro studio|Piapro]] characters, all of which are updated versions of their previous VOCALOID voicebanks. The designs for this version are their immediately previous VOCALOID designs altered with elements of their older/original designs.

This version of Rin combines elements of her original V2 design and [[Kagamine Rin (Vocaloid4)|V4X]] design. Distinguishing features include a [[lanyard]] with a [[piano print]] on it, [[grey shorts]] with buttons, and round [[headphones]]. title: hatsune_miku_(sp)
body:
The design for [[VOCALOID]] [[Hatsune Miku]]'s voicebank in the "PIAPRO CHARACTERS SUPER PACK" product announced on August 1st, 2024. As usual, this design was illustrated by [[iXima]].

The pack includes one new voicebank for each of the [[Piapro studio|Piapro]] characters, all of which are updated versions of their previous VOCALOID voicebanks. The designs for this version are their immediately previous VOCALOID designs altered with elements of their older/original designs.

This version of Miku is based on her [[Hatsune Miku (Vocaloid4)|V4X]] design. But now she has more voluminous hair like her V2 design. Her shirt no longer has the transparent trimming at the shoulders. Her sleeves are wide again instead of being skintight. Her necktie ends in a blunt diagonal end and her [[tie clip]] returns to the two clips of her VOCALOID2/3 design. Her [[lanyard]] also returns but with a [[piano print]] design rather than the triangles of her previous designs.

title: fairey_swordfish
body:
The Fairey Swordfish is a [[biplane]] used by the Royal Navy's Fleet Air Arm during [[World War II|World War II]].

Its crew of three sat in open cockpits, surrounded by a multitude of bracing wires. Power was provided by a Bristol Pegasus radial engine. Slow and obsolete, the 1930s-era "Stringbag" nevertheless achieved some spectacular successes during its service life, which extended all the way to 1946. Most notably the sinking of the battleship [[Bismarck (battleship)|]], in which the German anti-air gunners were not trained to fight against slow-flying yet highly agile aircraft, resulting in overshooting and missing the plane entirely.

Armament included one .303 caliber (7.7mm) [[machine gun]] for the pilot and one for the radio operator/gunner. For attack duties, the Swordfish could carry one [[torpedo]] or [[mine_(weapon)|mine]], or eight [[rocket|rockets]] on the lower wing.

h4. See also

* [[Bismarck]]
* [[fairey albacore]]
* [[fairey barracuda]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

title: fairey_barracuda
body:
The Fairey Barracuda was manufactured by the Fairey Aviation Company, and was used as a carrier-borne torpedo [[bomber]] and [[dive bomber]] by the [[Royal Navy]]'s Fleet Air Arm during the [[World War II]].
In "Operation Tungsten":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Tungsten] of 1944, 42 Barracudas from [[hms_furious_(47)|HMS Furious]] and [[hms_victorious_(r38)|Victorious]] raided [[Tirpitz]].
The aircraft is known for its high-wing style and flaw of spraying leaked hydraulic fluid contained ether into the pilot's face (in old documents this flaw is erroneously described as carbon monoxide leaking from the engine).

For the EADS Barracuda, use [[Barracuda (UAV)]].

h4.External Link

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairey_Barracuda]

h4.See also

* [[fairey swordfish]]
* [[fairey albacore]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: mighty_morphin_power_rangers
body:
The first series in Saban's [[Power Rangers]] franchise. Largely adapts stock footage from [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]] (along with newly filmed footage, often referred to as Zyu2), with elements from [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]] and [[Ninja Sentai Kakuranger]] being used for the second and third seasons respectively. The third season would also feature a crossover with [[Saban's Masked Rider]], serving as a quasi-backdoor pilot crossover for that show. 

[[Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers]], which used footage from Ninja Sentai Kakuranger, followed after its third season, and directly continues from its events; as a result, it is officially considered 'Season 3.5', with [[Power Rangers Zeo]] being the first full series after Mighty Morphin and Alien Rangers.

h4. Characters

title: 300_(movie)
body:
A 1998 American comic series by Frank Miller, later adapted into a 2007 movie by Zack Snyder; a fictional, fantasy-like retelling of the last stand of 300 Spartan [[hoplite]] warriors against an invading force of over a million [[Persia]]ns at the mountain pass of Thermopylae in central [[Greece]]. Best known for a scene in which the leader of the Spartans, [[Leonidas i]], tells off a Persian messenger with the iconic words "[[This is SPARTA]]", before throwing him down a well.

While the movie was a commercial success, it was generally disliked by Greeks and Iranians for the bastardization of their historical figures of each respective sides, along with numerous other historical inaccuracies.

h4. External Link

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/300_(film).

h4. See also

* [[Aspis]]
* [[Xiphos]]
* [[Oracle (Ancient Greece)]]
* [[Phalanx]]

title: mega-gravezord
body:
[i]WE NEED MEGA-GRAVEZORD NOW!!![/i]


--Red ranger

* Additional Formations

* Mega-Gravezord


The [b]Mega-Gravezord[/b] is the combination of the [[Dino Megazord]] and the [[Gravezord]]. In this form, the Megazord is enhanced by the Phoenix Thunderzord's wings for potential flight capability, has the White Tigerzord act as chest armor and equips it with claw and blade gauntlets, the Dragon Thunderzord's tail snaps onto the back and can be used as a flail while also adding kneepads, and Tor gives the Megazord an armored helmet.

* Tiger Attack

The [b]Tiger Attack[/b] is a claw slash attack from the Tigerzord claw mounted on the Mega-Gravezord's left arm.

* Inferno Blaster


The [b]Inferno Blaster[/b] is a giant Zord-sized version of the Black Ranger's Power Axe in gun mode. It is summoned by calling out the weapon's name, which causes it to teleport and materialize in the Mega-Gravezord's hands. Once fired, a massive blue burst of energy comes out of the gun, which completely destroys its target in one hit.

title: power_rangers:_battle_for_the_grid
body: 2019 [[Power Rangers]] fighting game developed by nWay. Featured a story mode loosely based on [[Power Rangers (boom! Studios)|Power Rangers Shattered Grid]], and continued the [[Street Fighter]] crossover started in [[Power Rangers: Legacy Wars]]. Gameplay-wise follows in the legacy of [[Marvel vs. Capcom]].

title: tommy_oliver
body:
A [[Power Rangers]] character, best known as the original [[Mighty Morphin Green Ranger|Mighty Morphin Green]] & [[Mighty Morphin White Ranger|White Ranger]] in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] (additionally serving as the Mighty Morphin-unique White Ninja Ranger). He would go on to be the longest-serving Power Ranger in the entire franchise, serving as [[Zeo Ranger V Red]] in [[Power Rangers Zeo]], the original [[Red Turbo Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Turbo]], and the [[Black Dino Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Dino Thunder]], as well as returning in one of these suits in [[Power Rangers Wild Force]], [[Power Rangers S.P.D.]], Power Rangers Super Megaforce, and Power Rangers Super Ninja Steel. He was played by the late [[Jason David Frank]].

An alternate version of Tommy would appear in the [[Power Rangers (boom! Studios)|Boom! Studios]] comics, where he acts as [[Lord Drakkon]], serving as the primary antagonist in the Shattered Grid event (and its adaptation in [[Power Rangers: Battle For The Grid]]).

title: the_protocols_of_the_elders_of_zion
body:
[b]The Protocols of the Elders of Zion[/b] is a fabricated text purporting to detail a Jewish plot for global domination. Largely plagiarized from several earlier sources, it was first published in Imperial Russia in 1903, translated into multiple languages, and disseminated internationally in the early part of the 20th century. It played a key part in popularizing belief in an international Jewish conspiracy.

h4.See also
* [[antisemitism]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: The Protocols of the Elders of Zion":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Protocols_of_the_Elders_of_Zion]

title: sogeking
body:
A mysterious sniper who comes from Sniper Island.

[spoiler]In reality, the SogeKing (King of Snipers) is an alter ego made up by Usopp (a paper-thin disguise everyone but [[Monkey D. Luffy|their air-headed captain]] saw through immediately) after he was (temporarily) kicked out of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] because of a falling-out with Luffy over the decommissioning of their first ship, the [[Going Merry]].[/spoiler]

title: leopardon
body:
[[Spider-Man|Spider-Man's]] [[mecha]] from the 1970's [[tokusatsu]] [[Spider-Man (Toei)|TV show]].

This mecha was included due to the popularity of a previous Toei robot, Daitetsujin 17, and would ultimately be responsible for popularizing giant robots in tokusatsu, especially [[Super Sentai]], which has utilized giant robots since [[Battle Fever J]].

title: bread_bowl
body:
A bread bowl is a [[loaf of bread]] that has had its top cut off and the loaf hollowed out to be used as an edible bowl for thick soups and stews.  Alternatively they may be used with dips, allowing people to tear off bits of the bread to dip.

title: chirou_(osu!)
body:
From "osu! mascots wiki page":[https://osu.ppy.sh/wiki/en/Mascots]:
[quote]Designed by "pyun":[https://osu.ppy.sh/users/981534], Chirou was one of the participants in the osu!taiko mascot design contest. She is very strict and demanding, a perfectionist, and does not like making mistakes — especially in her beats in osu!taiko. But past her strong outlook, if you get to her soft spot, she can be fluffy and cute. She is 14 years old, born on October 25th with blood type AB. She is also 4 feet 11 inches and weighs 100 pounds. Her hobbies include practising drumming, keeping warm in her cape, and collecting gems or rocks. Chirou has made some appearances in various user fanart submissions.[/quote]

title: tsubakisakuhana_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Tsubakisakuhana Girls' High School in [[Love Live! School Idol Musical]].

The main [[winter uniform]] is a [[serafuku]] that consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[green shirt|green]] [[shirt]] with a [[breast pocket]], a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], a [[grey bowtie|grey]] [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[bowtie]], a [[medium skirt|medium-length]] [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks|white]] [[socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[shoes]]. Due to the school's focus on tradition, the uniform's attributes are [i]not[/i] freely customizable.

The [[summer uniform]] (shown in [[love live! school idol musical the drama|the drama adaptation]]) instead has a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[green sailor collar]], a [[white ribbon|white]] [[neck ribbon]] and a [[black skirt]].

h4. See also
* [[Takizakura school uniform]]

title: hololive_idol_uniform_(color_rise)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by [[hololive]] members for the 2025 live concert "hololive 6th fes. Color Rise Harmony". designed by [[Amagai Tarou]], the official name is "Color Rise outfit" "according to the artist":[https://x.com/ordan/status/1879935373918540254]

It consists of a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[multicolored shirt|multicolored]] [[black shirt|black]] and [[white shirt|white]] with [[center frills]] and a [[single sleeve]] featuring the talent's [[color-coded|key color]], a [[single detached sleeve|single detached]] [[puffy detached sleeves|puffy]] [[puffy short sleeves|short sleeve]], either a [[black skirt|black]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] or [[black pants|black]] [[single pantsleg|single-legged pants]], both of them with a color-coded [[overskirt]], ether a  [[thigh strap]] or a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] with a [[single garter strap]], color-coded [[ankle socks]] and of [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]] with [[platform boots|platform]] [[platform heels|heels]].

title: gweon_sua
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A Korean librarian and book-lover who is forced to take part in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island. She has an exceptional photographic memory that allows her to remember anything she's read perfectly.

Has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[huge breasts]]. Her eyes are often drawn with [[shamrock]]s in them.

title: yugiri_tsuzuri
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 102nd class. She is often absent-minded, and has a peculiar way of speaking. But on stage, she is an excellent performer.

She has [[red eyes|red]]/[[pink eyes]] and [[short hair]] which is predominantly [[white hair|white]]-to-[[grey hair|grey]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]. Her hair is typically styled in an [[inverted bob]] with [[diagonal bangs]] and [[star hair ornament]]s.

She often wears [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]], and [[black shoes]] with her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|uniform]]. She also wears the choker with her [[summer uniform]].

Voiced by [[Sasaki Kotoko]].

title: elesa_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Elesa[/b], known as [b]Kamitsure[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon bw|Pokémon Black and White]][/i].

This Electric-type Gym Leader also works as a model. Watching her battle in the beautiful, bright lights of her Gym can be mesmerizing [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Zebstrika]].

In [[pokemon bw2|BW2]], she has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[purple hair|hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[blunt bangs]]. She wears [[headphones]], a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[fur jacket|jacket]], [[red nails|red]] and [[blue nails|blue]] [[nail polish]], a [[crop top]] and [[bike shorts]] tied by [[buckle]], and [[flats]]

title: nerissa_ravencroft
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of the third generation of [[hololive english]] [[holoadvent|-Advent-]]. She describes herself as a Demon of Sound and a lover of idols. Designed by [[Kim Eb]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]], [[large breasts]], [[uneven horns]] (canonically she had one of her horns broken to reduce her power) decorated with small [[horn flower|flowers]], and [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[low wings]]. Her default hairstyle is [[swept bangs]] with [[sidelocks]] decorated with a small [[tassel hair ornament]] tied into a [[flower knot]].

Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi was a turn-base gacha RPG developed by [[Square Enix]] for iOS and Android (and was later ported for the PC through Shift for docomo platform). The game was released on March 18, 2018. Service of this game ended on October 29, 2021.

This game features a new main character and a new story, while also had recurring characters from its anime.

title: spider-woman
body:
A [[Marvel]] superhero, civilian identity [[Jessica Drew]]. While she is considered one of the various Spider-heroes in the Marvel multiverse, her origin, powers, and most of her stories are largely separate from [[Spider-Man]].

Spider-Woman's Ultimate universe incarnation is an exception however, as she is a female clone of [[Peter Parker]]. 

The Spider-Woman mantle has also been briefly held by other female Spider-heroes such as [[Mayday Parker]]/[[Spider-Girl]] and [[Gwen Stacy]]/[[Spider-Gwen]]. Most of these cases were only temporary, or only used by that character in their home universe, and neither changed costumes to go with the name.

title: jessica_drew
body:
The civilian identity of [[Spider-Woman]].

While the original comic version of Jessica is a standalone character, the Ultimate universe version is a female clone of [[Peter Parker]] who retains Peter's abilities, memories, and feelings towards other characters.

For the version of Jessica from [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]] see [[Jessica Drew (Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse)]].

title: death_knight_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

A murderous, bloodthirsty knight clad in black armor and wearing a helmet shaped like a demonic skull. His weapon of choice is a scythe known as the Scythe of Sariel.

His true identity is [spoilers][[Jeritza von Hrym]].[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3588987

title: jeritza_von_hrym
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]

A Teacher in the Office Academy at Garreg Mach Monastery, in charge of armed combat training, his specialty being swords and lances.

He's [spoilers]also the [[Death Knight_(fire_emblem)|]], the dreaded Skull-Masked knight, and his actual loyatly belongs to the Adrestian Empire.[/spoilers]

He was born [spoiler]as Emile von Bartels, and is [[Mercedes_von_Martritz|Mercedes]]'s half-brother.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3690802

title: helm_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

The leader of the Aegis squad along with [[Mast (nikke)|]] and [[Anchor (nikke)|]], which is the Ark's naval division. Helm oversees the Admire, an amphibious battleship. Her one dream is to finally embark Admire in a naval combat. Despite being a nikke meant for sea operations, Helm doesn't like sea creatures.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[braid|braided]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[military jacket]] which resembles [[naval uniform]] with [[shoulder boards]] or [[epaulettes]], [[white gloves]] and a [[peaked cap|peaked]] [[military hat]] which clips over her hair. [[Badge]]s can be found on the left part of her chest and an [[armband]] on her left [[long sleeves|sleeves]]. Her lower body attire consists of [[white shorts|white]] [[shorts]] and [[high heels]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24909915: Default
* !asset #24909963: [[Helm (Aqua Marine) (nikke)|Aqua Marine]]
* !asset #24909914: [[Helm (Chandelier) (nikke)|Chandelier]]

title: nursery_rhyme_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the manifestation of Nursery Rhymes, and she is a representation of the imaginations and dreams of children across the ages.

First appears as an Enemy Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]]. [[Alice (fate)|]] is her Master in that game, and Nursery Rhyme borrows her appearance. To tell the two apart, Nursery Rhyme wears black and purple clothes.

Designed by [[Wada Arco]] and voiced by [[Nonaka Ai]].

title: kishibe_rohan_wa_ugokanai_(live_action)
body: A live-action adaptation of [[Kishibe Rohan wa Ugokanai]] series. The drama aired for 3 seasons in 2020-2022, each as a three-episode miniseries. It later received a movie adaptation in 2023, an additional drama episode in 2024, and a second (upcoming) movie in 2025. Stars [[Takahashi Issei]] as [[Kishibe Rohan]] and Iitoyo Marie as [[izumi kyouka (jojo)|Izumi Kyouka]], his editor.

title: white-faced_varre
body:
[b]White-faced Varre[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is often the first character that the [[Tarnished (Elden Ring)|]] will speak to, calling them [[no bitches? (meme)|maidenless]], along with giving them some small advice. He wears a white-faced [[mask]], from which he takes his name.

[spoilers]Varre is actually a servant of [[mohg lord of blood|Mohg, Lord of Blood]], and gradually encourages the Tarnished to take part in greater [[blood|bloodshed]] as they progress.[/spoilers]

title: kawashiro_nitori
body:
The "Super Youkai Warhead". Stage 3 midboss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Mountain of Faith]][/i], and later a recurring playable character.

A [[kappa]] engineer from [[Youkai Mountain]] with the power to control water as well as a technology genius. Since kappas normally love [[cucumber]]s, she is mostly seen holding one (and sometimes a bottle of Pepsi Ice Cucumber). When first introduced she was depicted as shy and good-natured, but her subsequent appearances revealed a greedier and more outspoken side of her.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23943823

She has [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] in [[two side up]] fastened with [[hair bobbles]], and a [[green hat|green]] [[cabbie hat]]. Her outfit is a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[blue shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[key necklace]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[blue skirt]] with [[pocket]]s, and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[rubber boots]]. She often has her large [[backpack]], usually either [[blue bag|blue]] or [[green bag|green]]. 

A trend of drawing her in a [[black tank top]] as an [[alternate costume]] has also become popular.

h4. See also

* [[Kawashiro Mitori]] (fan-created older sister)
* "Nitori Electronics Consumer Catalog":[/pools/4145]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Nitori Kawashiro":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Nitori_Kawashiro

title: catherine_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. Also known as Cassandra Rubens Charon. 

Known by the moniker "Thunder Catherine" (formerly "Thunderstrike Cassandra"), she is one of the strongest members of the Knights of Seiros. She has a Major Crest of Charon and wields the Heroes' Relic [[Thunderbrand]].

title: leopard_print
body:
Clothing or an object that has a [[leopard]] fur pattern printed on it, or less commonly a symbol of a leopard's body or face.

Leopard print is usually yellow with black or brown spots. Sometimes it may be pink.

Commonly associated with hypersexual women stereotypes, such as [[gyaru]] or "cougars" ([[mature female]]s who pursue young men).

Not to be confused with [[tiger print]]. Leopards have spots while tigers have stripes.

h4. Examples

* !post #8813338
* !post #5073277
* !asset #24760629

title: crowbar
body:
A hooked or curved steel bar that used as an [[tools|tool]] to open locked, closed or other inaccessible object, usually [[crate]]s or [[door]]s made of wood or metal, or demolish items and structure, like sledgehammer. it has two flat claws on both ends to pry the object open, its "teeth" the gap on the claw of its hooked end (hooked end is also known as the crowbar "heel") is used as an physical space for prying [[nail (hardware)|]] out of wooden [[plank]]. 

Signature weapon of [[Gordon Freeman]] of the [[Half-life (series)|]] series and [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyarlathotep]] of [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]].

title: yamagumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yamagumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into a [[single braid]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[green bowtie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[bike shorts]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]].

title: where's_the_cat?_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]]tic [[3koma]] comic format originated from a comic by [[Deadnooodles]]. It involves the "victim" being offered to show a [[cat]] by the "predator". After they have entered the room, the predator locks the door behind them.

Then, the victim asks where is the cat, the predator [[whispering|whispered]] "meow" (or its derivative), much to their horror as they realized that they are now [[you gonna get raped|trapped together]].

h4. Origins
* !post #4637318: Original
* !post #4976342: Popular version

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(female)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as female.

She has [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. In her default attire which is [[Chaldea uniform]], she has a [[side ponytail]]/[[one side up]] tied by a yellow [[hair scrunchie]], and wears a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[white_footwear|white]] [[boots]].

She has roughly the same characterization as the [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)|male version]]. She does, however, have an alternate characterization from the "Learn with Manga!" (pool #10385) comics, where she is more depraved and quick to [[female pervert|perv]] on other female Servants, particularly [[Mash Kyrielight]].

The [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|male protagonist]] is colloquially called Gudao. The name Gudako could come from an abbreviation of [b]Gu[/b]rando Oo[b]da[/b]a, or from "Gudaguda Order" (ぐだぐだオーダー), an official series of Grand Order comics 
("English":[http://fate-go.us/gudao/], "Japanese":[https://www.fate-go.jp/gudao/]). Ko is a common ending for female names and can also mean girl.

Her appearance is based on [[Emiya Shirou]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sekine Akira]]

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as male.

He has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[blue eyes]]. Usually seen wearing a [[Chaldea uniform]].

As he is a player character, he does not have much characterization within the game itself. However, he receives more personality in manga and anime adaptations. He also makes cameo appearances in the [i]Learn With Manga![/i] series, where he regularly makes passes at [[Astolfo (fate)|]] and is apparently the [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(female)|female protagonist]]'s pretend pro-wrestling partner.

His appearance is based on [[Tohsaka Rin]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]]

title: just_the_two_of_us_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a YouTube clip of the 1981 song "Just the Two of Us" by Glover Washington Jr. with no modifications except a static frame of a real person paired with an anime character in [[monochrome]].

The first instance inset an anime screencap render of [[Fujiwara Chika]] with standing beside a [[photo background]] of [[Thomas Shelby]].

It later spawned numerous variants, such as the one featuring two cats and the deepfake version featuring an [[alien]] singing the song.

h4. Examples

* !post #6195866

h4. See also

* pool #1499: The Most Unlikely Couples

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/just-the-two-of-us]

title: varesa_(genshin_impact)
body:
Playable character from [[Genshin Impact]].

Varesa is a competitive eater from the Collective of Plenty. She participated in the 242nd Inferno Stomach Supremo competition and won by eating 80 servings of Hot Spring O'Clock. During the preliminary rounds of the 243rd competition, she joined the other tribes' preliminaries out of her sheer love of food.

title: kamui_gakupo
body:
Camui Gackpo (or Kamui Gakupo) is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Licensed as Gackpoid (がくっぽいど), he is voiced by singer, songwriter, and actor, GACKT. His appearance was illustrated by [[Miura Kentarou]], the creator of [[Berserk]]. His design is reminiscent of a [[samurai]] (with katakana included). He wears [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style clothing]] over a [[bodysuit]]. He has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] pulled into a [[ponytail]].

h4. Official art

* !post #269006
* !post #443345

h4. See also

* [[Kamui Gakupo (V3 Gackpoid)]]
* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: million_dreams_(idolmaster)
body:
Million Dreams is a [[LUXURY (idolmaster)|]] costume that primarily appears in the Million Live! brand. It was introduced in THE iDOLM@STER Million Live!. It has made subsequent appearances in the following 2nd Vision games, and the costume is used in THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! Theater Days as the costume for N+ card illustrations.

Although it is mainly associated with Million Live!, Million Dreams has appeared in the main games as well. The first time it appeared in a home console game was the PlayStation 3 version of THE iDOLM@STER 2, where it can be obtained from the game's eighteenth DLC catalog. It also appeared in THE iDOLM@STER ONE FOR ALL, where it is a base game costume that can be purchased in-game for 96,000 money at Lucky Rabbit.

h4. External links

* "project-imas wiki":https://project-imas.wiki/Million_Dreams

title: pink_apollo_(idolmaster)
body:
Pink apollo (ピンクアポロ) is a coloration of the [[cosmic & funny (idolmaster)|]] costume set from THE iDOLM@STER. It is pink and white with small amounts of red. Most of the see-through material is light green and the blinking lights are blue. The pink parts are frequently miscolored as being purple. Pink apollo is most commonly seen on Iori as it is(mostly) pink, her theme color. Pink apollo is actually the main cosmic & funny coloration but ever since inflation bran was used for the box art of THE iDOLM@STER Live For You!, inflation bran is most commonly used.

title: heavily_armed_high_school_girls
body:
[i]Juuheisou-gata Joshikousei:[/i] a series of illustrations by [[neco]] depicting girls (all named after numbers in Japanese or German) with futuristic weapons and combat gear. Some characters from this series have been adapted as [[figma]]. The characters sometimes wear clothing with a logo that says H.A.H.G.S. rather than H.A.H.S.G., which may be considered an example of [[Engrish text]].

h4. Characters

* [[Ichi (neco)|]] (ash-blonde hair, green eyes, 3 swords)
* [[Ni (neco)|]] (light blue hair, blue and red [[heterochromia]], 2 submachine guns)
* [[San (neco)|]] (blonde hair, red eyes, [[eyepatch]], 4 axes)
* [[Shi (neco)|]] (white hair with red tips, red eyes, 4 swords)
* [[Go (neco)| ]] (black hair, brown eyes, 6 knives)
* [[Roku (neco)|]] (grey hair, grey eyes, bow and arrows)
* [[Null (neco)|]] (grey hair, brown eyes, tanned, 6 swords or 4 gatling guns)
* [[Eins (neco)|]] (brown hair, brown eyes, scythe)
* [[Zwei (neco)|]] (white hair, purple eyes, buster sword)
* [[Drei (neco)|]] (blonde hair, yellow eyes, mace)

h4. See also
* [[Arms Note]], a similar series by [[Fukai Ryosuke]] with more emphasis on firearms.

title: yuki_miku_(2021)
body:
"Glowing Snow ver"

The 2021 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest was "illumination". The winning design by [[annatumikan]] features a choir outfit with a clock motif based on the [[Sapporo Clock Tower]].

Her fan nickname is [i]Tokei-chan[/i] (Clock-chan).

She has a [[clock print]] [[beret]], [[white dress]] and [[capelet]], [[blue tabard]] with [[gold trim]] and [[Christmas lights]] adorning her hair and dress.

Her theme song is [b][[fondant_step_(vocaloid)|Fondant Step]][/b] by Heavenz.

title: yuki_miku
body:
A winter-themed version of [[Hatsune Miku]] used for the annual SNOW MIKU event running concurrently with the [[Sapporo (city)|]] Snow Festival. There are [[snowflakes]] printed into her hair, and she wears an ice-blue outfit with parts done in glimmering silver. Her partner is a small white [[rabbit]] named [[Rabbit Yukine]].

Since 2012, there is a yearly contest to decide which fan-submitted design will be used as the official Yuki Miku of that year, the winner of which also gets their design turned into a Petite [[Nendoroid]] by [[Goodsmile Company]].

h4. Versions

* [[yuki miku (2010)|2010]] - Hatsune Miku's usual outfit colored to blue, white, and silver. 
* [[yuki miku (2011)|2011]] - Same outfit as the 2010 version, but given [[earmuffs]], a white [[scarf]], and white [[mittens]]. Now used as the default Yuki Miku.
* [[yuki miku (2012)|2012]] - "Fluffy Coat version" (ふわふわコートVer.): Wears a blue ribbon [[hairband]] and a coat with white [[fur trim]]. Has [[fur-trimmed boots]] to match.
* [[yuki miku (2013)|2013]] - "Strawberry White Dress version" (いちご白無垢Ver.): Wears a white kimono and [[uchikake]].
* [[yuki miku (2014)|2014]] - "Magical Snow version": Wears a [[witch hat]], a blue [[cape]], and wields a [[staff]].
* [[yuki miku (2015)|2015]] - "Snow Bell version": has a plant motif, wears a white [[bubble skirt]] and [[capelet]].
* [[yuki miku (2016)|2016]] - "Snow Owl version": Wears an owl-shaped [[hat]] and sports gear.
* [[yuki miku (2017)|2017]] - "Twinkle Snow version": Wields a [[wand]] and wears a sleeveless blue [[dress]].
* [[yuki miku (2018)|2018]] - "Crane Priestess version" (タンチョウ巫女Ver.): Has a crane-themed [[miko]] outfit with [[striped_legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]].
* [[yuki miku (2019)|2019]] - "Princess version": Wields a [[scepter]] and wears a green and white [[frilled dress]], with a crystal [[tiara]], [[detached collar]], and equally as [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]].
* [[yuki miku (2020)|2020]] - "Snow Parade version": A [[band uniform]] motif with a [[french horn]], [[epaulettes]] that have a [[fringe trim]], and [[hat feather]].
* [[yuki miku (2021)|2021]] - "Glowing Snow version": A choir outfit with a clock motif featuring a [[clock print]] [[beret]] and [[white dress]].
* [[yuki miku (2022)|2022]] - "Grand Voyage version": A naval captain outfit with a crab motif featuring red [[hair ribbon]] that resemble crab claws and a [[fur-trimmed coat]].
* [[yuki miku (2023)|2023]] - "Serene Winter version": A pink and blue pastel palette [[kimono]] with a daybreak motif. She wields a [[giant brush]].
* [[yuki miku (2024)|2024]] - "Winter Feast version": A traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese outfit]] with a [[soup curry]] motif.
* [[yuki miku (2025)|2025]] - "Crystal Snow version": Carries an [[icicle]] [[wand]] and wears various winter-themed accessories, including [[icicle]], [[snowball]], and [[crystal|ice crystal]] [[hair ornament]]s.

h4. Appearance

!post #6957176: Successive Yuki Miku as of 2024; from bottom-to-top, left-to-right.

h4. See also

* [[Sakura Miku]] (spring)
* [[Aki Miku]] (autumn)
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "Official SNOW MIKU site":[http://snowmiku.com/]

title: louisiana
body:
Use for posts referencing the [[United States|US]] state of Louisiana. 

Louisiana (French: Louisiane; Louisiana Creole: Lwizyàn) is a state in the Southern [[United States|United States of America]]. Its counties are called parishes (French: Paroisses; Creole: pawas). The state borders [[Texas]] to the west, [[Arkansas]] to the north, and [[Mississippi]] to the east. Its capital is Baton Rouge and its largest city is [[New Orleans]] (French: Nouvelle-Órleans; Creole: Nouvèl Orleans)

Famous foods of Louisiana are Gumbo, jambalaya, crawfish boil, king cake (French: gallette des rois), beignets, étoufée, and boudin. One famous holiday   that Louisiana is heavily associated with in the public consciousness is [[Mardi Gras]] (Fat Tuesday) which is celebrated in late winter/early spring.

h4. See Also

* [[Voodoo]]
* [[Quebec]]

h4. External Links 
* "Wikipedia: Louisiana":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louisiana]

body:

body: [[GUMI]]'s [[Vocaloid|VOCALOID6]] voicebank, with design illustrated by [[nou (nounknown)]]. Her design is similar to her previous Vocaloid designs with [[red goggles]], [[orange jacket]], [[yellow shirt]], [[green tube top]], and [[layered skirt|layered]] orange and green skirt. Her headphones and belt are inspired by the Yamaha TENORI-ON instrument and her clothing have a 6 motif (6 folds in the jacket, 6 arches of the upper skirt, 6 pleats of the lower skirt) in celebration of the release of VOCALOID6. Her later [[Gumi (SV)|Synthesizer V voicebank]] borrows the same design, but with her goggles, brooch, and belt being blue instead of red and green. h4. title: we_can_do_it!
body:
A [[World War II]] [[propaganda]] [[poster (medium)|]] by artist J. Howard Miller, depicting a muscular young woman in a work shirt and kerchief flexing her right biceps.

The poster was created to inspire factory workers at Westinghouse Electric (many of whom, like U.S. war workers generally, were women, due to the pressure places on the male workforce by the military draft).

The poster is often said to depict [[Rosie the Riveter]], and to have been used to recruit more women into the war production effort. Neither legend is true. Miller did not intend the poster to depict [[Rosie the Riveter]], nor was it used for general recruiting. Rather, its purpose was to exhort women (and men) who already worked for Westinghouse to work harder; the woman depicted in the poster is even wearing a Westinghouse employee badge on her shirt collar.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22620458

h4. See also

* [[Rosie the Riveter]]

title: tachibana_hibiki_(symphogear)
body:
She's one of the six main protagonists of the [[Senki Zesshou Symphogear]] series.

She is a Symphogear user and wields the Gungnir relic.

Hibiki has orange eyes with short light brown hair fastened with two red clips on either side of her head. She is most often seen wearing the uniform of Lydian Music Academy.

Hibiki has a [[scar on chest|scar on her chest]] in the shape of a 'forte' from when [[Amou Kanade|Kanade's]] Gungnir fragment pierced her chest on the day of the Zwei Wing concert.

title: slugcat
body:
The playable character species of the game [[Rain World]].

Salient qualities are smooth, monochromatic skin with [[solid eyes]], a thick tail, and a capability to carry and use tools such as spears.

The base game has three different playable slugcats:
* [[Survivor (rain world)|]] ([b]white[/b]) - The baseline experience. Survivor has no special attributes and average stats.
* [[Monk (rain world)|]] ([b]yellow[/b]) - Slightly decreases the difficulty level. The game is otherwise the same.
* [[Hunter (rain world)|]] ([b]pink[/b]) - [i]Greatly[/i] increases the difficulty. The game is also changed significantly, with both the player's start position and the end goal being different. [spoiler]Hunter's campaign chronologically takes place before Survivor's and Monk's.[/spoiler]

The "Downpour" DLC adds five more playable slugcats, all with unique campaigns, plus one secret slugcat. The game world also undergoes changes between campaigns, sometimes slightly, sometimes tremendously.
* [[Artificer (rain world)|]] ([b]maroon[/b]) - Pyrotechnic master, hates Scavengers. [spoiler]Takes place sometime before Hunter.[/spoiler]
* [[Gourmand (rain world)|]] ([b]orange[/b]) - A more... rotund slugcat than most. [spoiler]Takes place between Hunter and Survivor.[/spoiler]
* [[Spearmaster (rain world)|]] ([b]purple[/b], with white spots on tail) - Can produce spears on demand. Has no mouth. [spoiler]Takes place far before any other campaign in the timeline[/spoiler]
* [[Rivulet (rain world)|]] ([b]light blue[/b], with [[axolotl]]-like appendages) - Runs and swims extremely fast. They'll need it. [spoiler]Takes place a significant amount of time after Survivor's campaign[/spoiler]
* [[Saint (rain world)|]] ([b]green[/b]) - Nonviolent, vegetarian, and more than what they seem. [spoiler]Takes place far in the future, with a radically altered environment[/spoiler]
* [[Inv (rain world)|]] ([b]black[/b]) - Secret slugcat. More or less a joke, as their campaign contains various fourth-wall breaking elements and the difficulty is ramped to absurd levels. On the plus side, they start with a [[singularity bomb (rain world)|]]. [spoiler]Their campaign ends with a dating simulator.[/spoiler]

The upcoming (March 2025) DLC "The Watcher" adds the titular slugcat:
* [[Watcher (rain world)|]] ([b]navy blue[/b]) - unknown

title: santa_costume
body:
A [[Santa Claus]]-themed outfit. This involves prominent use of red fabric with white trim on the edges. As such, many types of clothing can be used in this style - swimsuits, undergarments, outerwear etc. A wide, black belt may be present.

Due to the many variations on this costume in different cultures through history, it should be noted that although red is the most popular color used in "Santa costumes" on Danbooru, it is [i]not the only[/i] color associated with "Santa." See below for alternate tagged colors.

Use the [[Santa hat]] tag when the majority of a character's clothing is not Santa-themed except for the hat.

Images with the actual Santa Claus character should be tagged with [[Santa Claus]].

title: kaname_madoka
body:
The protagonist of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

Her [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] is tied into [[short twintails|pigtails]]. She also has [[pink eyes]].

In her daily life, she typically wears the [[Mitakihara school uniform]] paired with [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] and [[red ribbon|red]] or [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]]s [[hair ribbon|in her hair]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair]] [[bow]]s, a [[red choker|red]] [[bow choker]], a [[pink gemstone|pink]] [[chest jewel]], a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with a [[square neckline]], [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short]] [[white sleeves]], a [[petticoat]], [[buttons]] and a [[heart cutout]] at the [[back cutout|back]], [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[miniskirt|short]] [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[bubble skirt]], [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[red shoes|red]] [[pumps]] with [[footwear_bow|straps]]. She fights using a [[bow (weapon)|]] and [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are none other than [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese) and [[Christine Marie Cabanos]] (English).

title: a-chan_(hololive)
body:
[b]Yuujin A[/b] (lit. "Friend A"), better known as [b]A-chan[/b] (Ei-chan), is a former (as of "the end of June 2024":[https://twitter.com/achan_UGA/status/1806583319725039822]) [[hololive]] staff member and director.

She has [[aqua eyes|aqua]] or [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]], a large [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]], and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Despite not officially being a [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] herself, she is a popular character in the hololive fandom, which reached the point that she eventually gained her own VTuber model (designed by [[Amagai Tarou]]). She used it to host various collab and announcement streams on the main hololive YouTube channel.

Her name refers to her status as a personal friend of [[Tokino Sora]], though she had never been a manager of her or any other hololive member.

title: guitar
body:
A plucked stringed [[instrument]], either [[electric guitar|electric]] or [[acoustic guitar|acoustic]], with a long neck.

Closely related to the [[bass guitar]] except that a standard guitar typically has [b]six strings[/b] and six tuning pegs at the top of the neck. On rare occasions a guitar may have more strings than that (e.g. 12).

Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular guitars. A bass guitar has four strings, while a regular guitar has six.

title: hatsune_miku
body:
Hatsune Miku is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, originally released for the VOCALOID2 engine on August 31, 2007. She was the first of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is recognizable by her [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]] and [[aqua eyes]], although she is commonly depicted with [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] or [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie]], has [[long sleeves|long]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has a [[number tattoo]] [[shoulder tattoo|on her shoulder]].

She is voiced by [[Fujita Saki]], and her first appearance was illustrated by [[KEI (Keigarou)|]].

title: ushio_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ushio[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] and [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Her [[cannon|12.7 cm twin gun mount]] is colored pink, and which has a [[:3]] face upon its top so that looking down at it, the cannon barrels look like ears on a bunny. She normally hugs her cannon tightly to her chest (to hide her chest, presumably). She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a notable [[ahoge]]. The [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to her thighs have puppy, kitty, bunny, and other cartoon animal [[sticker]]s on them. Her damaged CG reveals that she's hiding surprisingly [[large breasts]] for a destroyer/young girl. The reason for this may be that "Ushi" is the word for "cow", so she has "Ushi Oppai", or "cow tits", which is how some Japanese mock women with larger-than-normal cup sizes. Historically, the real-life [i]Ushio[/i] took part in many of the IJN's operations and was one of the extremely few surviving Japanese destroyers of [[World War II]], alongside only [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] of the ships in the game. Also famous for being a "lucky" ship, she is unlike [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] in the sense that she protected her companions instead of jinxing them. h4. title: kagamine_len
body:
Kagamine Len is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. He is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Rin]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. He is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for his V2 voicebank. His V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

He has [[blonde hair]] done in a [[short ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[bass clef]] print and [[necktie]]. He wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a white [[headset]].

His counterpart is Kagamine Rin. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.

h4. Official art
